<p>To control access to the documentation itself,
see <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#privacy-levels"><span class="std std-ref">Privacy levels</span></a>.</p>
</div>
</section>
<span id="document-commercial/single-sign-on"></span><section id="choosing-a-single-sign-on-sso-approach-for-your-organization">
<h3>Choosing a Single Sign-On (SSO) approach for your organization<a class="headerlink" href="#choosing-a-single-sign-on-sso-approach-for-your-organization" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>This feature is only available on <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.com/">Read the Docs for Business</a>.</p>
</div>
<p>Single sign-on is an optional feature on Read the Docs for Business for all users.
By default,
you will use <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/manage-read-the-docs-teams"><span class="doc">teams</span></a> within Read the Docs to manage user authorization.
<abbr title="single sign-on">SSO</abbr> will allow you to grant permissions to your organization‚Äôs projects in an easy way.</p>
<p>Currently, we support two different types of single sign-on:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Authentication <em>and</em> authorization are managed by the identity provider (GitHub, Bitbucket or GitLab)</p></li>
<li><p>Authentication (<em>only</em>) is managed by the identity provider (Google Workspace account with a verified email address)</p></li>
</ul>
<p>Users can log out by using the <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#logging-out"><span class="std std-ref">Log Out</span></a> link in the RTD flyout menu.</p>
<section id="single-sign-on-with-github-bitbucket-or-gitlab">
<span id="sso-git-provider"></span><h4>Single Sign-on with GitHub, Bitbucket, or GitLab<a class="headerlink" href="#single-sign-on-with-github-bitbucket-or-gitlab" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Using an identity provider that supports authentication and authorization allows organization owners to manage
who has access to projects on Read the Docs,
directly from the provider itself.
If a user needs access to your documentation project on Read the Docs,
that user just needs to be granted permissions in the Git repository associated with the project.</p>
<p>Once you enable this option,
your existing Read the Docs teams will not be used.
All authentication will be done using your git provider,
including any two-factor authentication and additional Single Sign-on that they support.</p>
<p>Learn how to configure this SSO method with our <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/setup-single-sign-on-github-gitlab-bitbucket"><span class="doc">How to setup Single Sign-On (SSO) with GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket</span></a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="sso-with-google-workspace">
<h4>SSO with Google Workspace<a class="headerlink" href="#sso-with-google-workspace" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>This feature allows you to restrict access to users with a specific email address (e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">employee&#64;company.com</span></code>),
where <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">company.com</span></code> is a registered Google Workspace domain.
As this identity provider does not provide authorization over each project a user has access to,
permissions are managed by the <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#team-types"><span class="std std-ref">internal Read the Docs‚Äôs teams</span></a> authorization system.</p>
<p>This feature is only available on the <strong>Pro plan</strong> and above.
Learn how to configure this SSO method with our <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/setup-single-sign-on-google-email"><span class="doc">How to setup Single Sign-On (SSO) with Google Workspace</span></a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="requesting-additional-providers">
<h4>Requesting additional providers<a class="headerlink" href="#requesting-additional-providers" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>We are always interested in hearing from our users about what authentication needs they have.
You can reach out to our <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-support"><span class="doc">Site support</span></a> to talk with us about any additional authentication needs you might have.</p>
<div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>Many additional providers can be supported via GitHub, Bitbucket, and GitLab SSO.
We will depend on those sites in order to authenticate you,
so you can use all your existing SSO methods already configured on those services.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
</div>
<div class="toctree-wrapper compound">
<span id="document-automation-rules"></span><section id="automation-rules">
<h3>Automation rules<a class="headerlink" href="#automation-rules" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Automation rules allow project maintainers to automate actions on new branches and tags in Git repositories.
If you are familiar with <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-GitOps"><span class="xref std std-term">GitOps</span></a>,
this might seem familiar.
The goal of automation rules is to be able to control versioning through your Git repository
and avoid duplicating these efforts on Read the Docs.</p>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/automation-rules"><span class="doc">How to manage versions automatically</span></a></dt><dd><p>A practical guide to managing automated versioning of your documentation.</p>
</dd>
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-versions"><span class="doc">Versioned documentation</span></a></dt><dd><p>General explanation of how versioning works on Read the Docs</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
<section id="how-automation-rules-work">
<h4>How automation rules work<a class="headerlink" href="#how-automation-rules-work" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>When a new tag or branch is pushed to your repository,
Read the Docs receives a webhook.
We then create a new Read the Docs <em>version</em> that matches your new Git <em>tag or branch</em>.</p>
<p>All automation rules are evaluated for this version,
in the order they are listed.
If the version <strong>matches</strong> the version type and the pattern in the rule,
the specified <strong>action</strong> is performed on that version.</p>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Versions can match multiple automation rules,
and all matching actions will be performed on the version.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="matching-a-version-in-git">
<h4>Matching a version in Git<a class="headerlink" href="#matching-a-version-in-git" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>We have a couple predefined ways to match against versions that are created,
and you can also define your own.</p>
<section id="predefined-matches">
<h5>Predefined matches<a class="headerlink" href="#predefined-matches" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Automation rules support two predefined version matches:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>Any version</strong>: All new versions will match the rule.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>SemVer versions</strong>: All new versions that follow <a class="reference external" href="https://semver.org/">semantic versioning</a> will match the rule.</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="custom-matches">
<h5>Custom matches<a class="headerlink" href="#custom-matches" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>If none of the above predefined matches meet your use case,
you can use a <strong>Custom match</strong>.</p>
<p>The custom match should be a valid <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html">Python regular expression</a>.
Each new version will be tested against this regular expression.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="actions-for-versions">
<h4>Actions for versions<a class="headerlink" href="#actions-for-versions" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>When an automation rule matches a new version,
the specified action is performed on that version.
Currently, the following actions are available:</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt>Activate version</dt><dd><p>Activates and builds the version.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Hide version</dt><dd><p>Hides the version. If the version is not active, activates it and builds the version.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#version-states"><span class="std std-ref">Version states</span></a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Make version public</dt><dd><p>Sets the version‚Äôs privacy level to public.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#privacy-levels"><span class="std std-ref">Privacy levels</span></a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Make version private</dt><dd><p>Sets the version‚Äôs privacy level to private.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#privacy-levels"><span class="std std-ref">Privacy levels</span></a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Set version as default</dt><dd><p>Sets the version as the <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-default-version"><span class="xref std std-term">default version</span></a>.
It also activates and builds the version.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#root-url-redirect"><span class="std std-ref">Root URL redirect at /</span></a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Delete version</dt><dd><p>When a branch or tag is deleted from your repository,
Read the Docs will delete it <em>only if isn‚Äôt active</em>.
This action allows you to delete <em>active</em> versions when a branch or tag is deleted from your repository.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>There are a couple caveats to these rules that are useful:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>The <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-default-version"><span class="xref std std-term">default version</span></a> isn‚Äôt deleted even if it matches a rule.
You can use the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Set</span> <span class="pre">version</span> <span class="pre">as</span> <span class="pre">default</span></code> action to change the default version
before deleting the current one.</p></li>
<li><p>If your versions follow <span class="target" id="index-0"></span><a class="pep reference external" href="https://peps.python.org/pep-0440/"><strong>PEP 440</strong></a>,
Read the Docs activates and builds the version if it‚Äôs greater than the current stable version.
The stable version is also automatically updated at the same time.
See more in <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-versions"><span class="doc">Versioned documentation</span></a>.</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="order">
<h4>Order<a class="headerlink" href="#order" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>When a new Read the Docs version is created,
all rules with a successful match will have their action triggered,
in the order they appear on the <span class="guilabel">Automation Rules</span> page.</p>
</section>
<section id="examples">
<h4>Examples<a class="headerlink" href="#examples" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<section id="activate-all-new-tags">
<h5>Activate all new tags<a class="headerlink" href="#activate-all-new-tags" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Match: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Any</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Version type: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Tag</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Action: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Activate</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="activate-only-new-branches-that-belong-to-the-1-x-release">
<h5>Activate only new branches that belong to the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.x</span></code> release<a class="headerlink" href="#activate-only-new-branches-that-belong-to-the-1-x-release" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Custom match: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">^1\.\d+$</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Version type: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Branch</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Action: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Activate</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="delete-an-active-version-when-a-branch-is-deleted">
<h5>Delete an active version when a branch is deleted<a class="headerlink" href="#delete-an-active-version-when-a-branch-is-deleted" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Match: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Any</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Version type: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Branch</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Action: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Delete</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="set-as-default-new-tags-that-have-the-stable-or-release-suffix">
<h5>Set as default new tags that have the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">-stable</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">-release</span></code> suffix<a class="headerlink" href="#set-as-default-new-tags-that-have-the-stable-or-release-suffix" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Custom match: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">-(stable|release)$</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Version type: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Tag</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Action: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Set</span> <span class="pre">version</span> <span class="pre">as</span> <span class="pre">default</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>You can also create two rules:
one to match <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">-stable</span></code> and other to match <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">-release</span></code>.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="activate-all-new-tags-and-branches-that-start-with-v-or-v">
<h5>Activate all new tags and branches that start with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">v</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">V</span></code><a class="headerlink" href="#activate-all-new-tags-and-branches-that-start-with-v-or-v" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Custom match: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">^[vV]</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Version type: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Tag</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Action: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Activate</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Custom match: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">^[vV]</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Version type: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Branch</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Action: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Activate</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="activate-all-new-tags-that-don-t-contain-the-nightly-suffix">
<h5>Activate all new tags that don‚Äôt contain the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">-nightly</span></code> suffix<a class="headerlink" href="#activate-all-new-tags-that-don-t-contain-the-nightly-suffix" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Custom match: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.*(?&lt;!-nightly)$</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Version type: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Tag</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Action: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Activate</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
</section>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-badges"></span><section id="status-badges">
<h3>Status badges<a class="headerlink" href="#status-badges" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Status badges let you show the state of your documentation to your users.
They will show if the latest build has passed, failed, or is in an unknown state.
They are great for embedding in your README,
or putting inside your actual doc pages.</p>
<p>You can see a badge in action in the <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/blob/main/README.rst">Read the Docs README</a>.</p>
<section id="display-states">
<h4>Display states<a class="headerlink" href="#display-states" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Badges have the following states which can be shown to users:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>Green</strong>: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">passing</span></code> - the last build was successful.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>Red</strong>: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">failing</span></code> - the last build failed.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>Yellow</strong>: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">unknown</span></code> - we couldn‚Äôt figure out the status of your last build.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>An example of each is shown here:</p>
<p><img alt="green" src="https://assets.readthedocs.org/static/projects/badges/passing-flat.svg" />¬†<img alt="red" src="https://assets.readthedocs.org/static/projects/badges/failing-flat.svg" />¬†<img alt="yellow" src="https://assets.readthedocs.org/static/projects/badges/unknown-flat.svg" /></p>
</section>
<section id="automatically-generated">
<h4>Automatically generated<a class="headerlink" href="#automatically-generated" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>On the dashboard of a project, an example badge is displayed
together with code snippets for reStructuredText, Markdown, and HTML.</p>
<p>Badges are generated on-demand for all Read the Docs projects, using the following URL syntax:</p>
<div class="highlight-text notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>https://readthedocs.org/projects/&lt;project-slug&gt;/badge/?version=&lt;version&gt;&amp;style=&lt;style&gt;
</pre></div>
</div>
</section>
<section id="style">
<h4>Style<a class="headerlink" href="#style" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>You can pass the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">style</span></code> GET argument to get custom styled badges.
This allows you to match the look and feel of your website.
By default, the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">flat</span></code> style is used.</p>
<table class="docutils align-default">
<thead>
<tr class="row-odd"><th class="head"><p>Style</p></th>
<th class="head"><p>Badge</p></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p>flat - default</p></td>
<td><p><img alt="Flat Badge" src="https://readthedocs.org/projects/pip/badge/?version=latest&amp;style=flat" /></p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p>flat-square</p></td>
<td><p><img alt="Flat-Square Badge" src="https://readthedocs.org/projects/pip/badge/?version=latest&amp;style=flat-square" /></p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p>for-the-badge</p></td>
<td><p><img alt="Badge" src="https://readthedocs.org/projects/pip/badge/?version=latest&amp;style=for-the-badge" /></p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p>plastic</p></td>
<td><p><img alt="Plastic Badge" src="https://readthedocs.org/projects/pip/badge/?version=latest&amp;style=plastic" /></p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p>social</p></td>
<td><p><img alt="Social Badge" src="https://readthedocs.org/projects/pip/badge/?version=latest&amp;style=social" /></p></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</section>
<section id="version-specific-badges">
<h4>Version-specific badges<a class="headerlink" href="#version-specific-badges" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>You can change the version of the documentation your badge points to.
To do this, you can pass the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">version</span></code> GET argument to the badge URL.
By default, it will point at the <em>default version</em> you have specified for your project.</p>
<p>The badge URL looks like this:</p>
<div class="highlight-text notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>https://readthedocs.org/projects/&lt;project-slug&gt;/badge/?version=latest
</pre></div>
</div>
</section>
<section id="badges-on-dashboard-pages">
<h4>Badges on dashboard pages<a class="headerlink" href="#badges-on-dashboard-pages" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>On each <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-project-home"><span class="xref std std-term">project home</span></a> page there is a badge that communicates the status of the default version.
If you click on the badge icon,
you will be given snippets for reStructuredText, Markdown, and HTML
to make embedding it easier.</p>
</section>
<section id="badges-for-private-projects">
<h4>Badges for private projects<a class="headerlink" href="#badges-for-private-projects" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>This feature is only available on <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.com/">Read the Docs for Business</a>.</p>
</div>
<p>For private projects, a badge URL cannot be guessed.
A token is needed to display it.
Private badge URLs are displayed on a private project‚Äôs dashboard in place of public URLs.</p>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-canonical-urls"></span><section id="canonical-urls">
<h3>Canonical URLs<a class="headerlink" href="#canonical-urls" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>A <a class="reference external" href="https://developers.google.com/search/docs/advanced/crawling/consolidate-duplicate-urls">canonical URL</a>
allows you to specify the preferred version of a web page to prevent duplicated content.
Here are some examples of when a canonical URL is used:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Search engines use your canonical URL to link users to the correct version and domain of your documentation.</p></li>
<li><p>Many popular chat clients and social media networks generate link previews,
using your canonical URL as the final destination.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>If canonical URLs aren‚Äôt used,
it‚Äôs easy for outdated documentation to be the top search result for various pages in your documentation.
This is not a perfect solution for this problem,
but generally people finding outdated documentation is a big problem,
and this is one of the suggested ways to solve it from search engines.</p>
<div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>In most cases, Read the Docs will automatically generate a canonical URL for Sphinx projects.
Most Sphinx users do not need to take further action.</p>
</div>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/canonical-urls"><span class="doc">How to enable canonical URLs</span></a></dt><dd><p>More information on how to enable canonical URLs in your project.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
<section id="how-read-the-docs-generates-canonical-urls">
<h4>How Read the Docs generates canonical URLs<a class="headerlink" href="#how-read-the-docs-generates-canonical-urls" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>The canonical URL takes the following into account:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>The default version of your project (usually ‚Äúlatest‚Äù or ‚Äústable‚Äù).</p></li>
<li><p>The canonical <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-custom-domains"><span class="doc">custom domain</span></a> if you have one,
otherwise the default <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#default-subdomain"><span class="std std-ref">subdomain</span></a> will be used.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>For example, if you have a project named <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">example-docs</span></code>
with a custom domain <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://docs.example.com</span></code>,
then your documentation will be served at <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://example-docs.readthedocs.io</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://docs.example.com</span></code>.
Without specifying a canonical URL, a search engine like Google will index both domains.</p>
<p>You‚Äôll want to use <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://docs.example.com</span></code> as your canonical domain.
This means that when Google indexes a page like <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://example-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/</span></code>,
it will know that it should really point at <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://docs.example.com/en/latest/</span></code>,
thus avoiding duplicating the content.</p>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>If you want your custom domain to be set as the canonical, you need to set <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Canonical:</span>&#160; <span class="pre">This</span> <span class="pre">domain</span> <span class="pre">is</span> <span class="pre">the</span> <span class="pre">primary</span> <span class="pre">one</span> <span class="pre">where</span> <span class="pre">the</span> <span class="pre">documentation</span> <span class="pre">is</span> <span class="pre">served</span> <span class="pre">from</span></code> in the <span class="guilabel">Admin</span> &gt; <span class="guilabel">Domains</span> section of your project settings.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="implementation">
<h4>Implementation<a class="headerlink" href="#implementation" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>A canonical URL is automatically specified in the HTML output with a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">&lt;link&gt;</span></code> element.
For instance, regardless of whether you are viewing this page on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/en/latest</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/en/stable</span></code>,
the following HTML header data will be present:</p>
<div class="highlight-html notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">link</span> <span class="na">rel</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;canonical&quot;</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/canonical-urls.html&quot;</span> <span class="p">/&gt;</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-feature-flags"></span><section id="feature-flags">
<h3>Feature flags<a class="headerlink" href="#feature-flags" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Read the Docs offers a few additional settings that are otherwise disabled by default.
These specific settings are called <em>feature flags</em> and can only be enabled by <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/support.html">contacting us through our support form</a>
or reaching out to the administrator of your service.</p>
<section id="available-flags">
<h4>Available flags<a class="headerlink" href="#available-flags" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">CONDA_APPEND_CORE_REQUIREMENTS</span></code>: Append Read the Docs core requirements to environment.yml file.</p>
<p>Makes Read the Docs to install all the requirements at once on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conda</span> <span class="pre">create</span></code> step.
This helps users to pin dependencies on conda and to improve build time.</p>
<p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">DONT_OVERWRITE_SPHINX_CONTEXT</span></code>: Do not overwrite context vars in conf.py with Read the Docs context.</p>
<p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">DONT_CREATE_INDEX</span></code>: Do not create index.md or README.rst if the project does not have one.</p>
<p>When Read the Docs detects that your project doesn‚Äôt have an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">index.md</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">README.rst</span></code>,
it auto-generate one for you with instructions about how to proceed.</p>
<p>In case you are using a static HTML page as index or an generated index from code,
this behavior could be a problem. With this feature flag you can disable that.</p>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-flyout-menu"></span><section id="flyout-menu">
<h3>Flyout menu<a class="headerlink" href="#flyout-menu" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>When you are using a Read the Docs site,
you will likely notice that we embed a menu on all the documentation pages we serve.
This is a way to expose the functionality of Read the Docs on the page,
without having to have the documentation theme integrate it directly.</p>
<section id="functionality">
<h4>Functionality<a class="headerlink" href="#functionality" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>The flyout menu provides access to the following bits of Read the Docs functionality:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>A <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-versions"><span class="doc">version switcher</span></a> that shows users all of the active, unhidden versions they have access to.</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-downloadable-documentation"><span class="doc">Offline formats</span></a> for the current version, including HTML &amp; PDF downloads that are enabled by the project.</p></li>
<li><p>Links to the Read the Docs dashboard for the project.</p></li>
<li><p>Links to your <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-integrations"><span class="doc">VCS provider</span></a> that allow the user to quickly find the exact file that the documentation was rendered from.</p></li>
<li><p>A search bar that gives users access to our <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-server-side-search/index"><span class="doc">Server side search</span></a> of the current version.</p></li>
</ul>
<section id="closed">
<h5>Closed<a class="headerlink" href="#closed" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>

<img alt="_images/flyout-closed.png" src="_images/flyout-closed.png" />

<p><span class="caption-text">The flyout when it‚Äôs closed</span><a class="headerlink" href="#id1" title="Permalink to this image">ÔÉÅ</a></p>
</figcaption>
</figure>
</section>

<section id="information-for-theme-authors">
<h4>Information for theme authors<a class="headerlink" href="#information-for-theme-authors" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>People who are making custom documentation themes often want to specify where the flyout is injected,
and also what it looks like.
We support both of these use cases for themes.</p>
<section id="defining-where-the-flyout-menu-is-injected">
<h5>Defining where the flyout menu is injected<a class="headerlink" href="#defining-where-the-flyout-menu-is-injected" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>The flyout menu injection looks for a specific selector (<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">#readthedocs-embed-flyout</span></code>),
in order to inject the flyout.
You can add <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">&lt;div</span> <span class="pre">id=&quot;readthedocs-embed-flyout&quot;&gt;</span></code> in your theme,
and our JavaScript code will inject the flyout there.
All other themes except for the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sphinx_rtd_theme</span></code> have the flyout appended to the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">&lt;body&gt;</span></code>.</p>
</section>
<section id="styling-the-flyout">
<h5>Styling the flyout<a class="headerlink" href="#styling-the-flyout" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>HTML themes can style the flyout to make it match the overall style of the HTML.
By default the flyout has it‚Äôs <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/sphinx_rtd_theme/blob/master/src/sass/_theme_badge.sass">own CSS file</a>,
which you can look at to see the basic CSS class names.</p>
<p>The example HTML that the flyout uses is included here,
so that you can style it in your HTML theme:</p>
<div class="highlight-html notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">div</span> <span class="na">class</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;injected&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
   <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">div</span> <span class="na">class</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;rst-versions rst-badge shift-up&quot;</span> <span class="na">data-toggle</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;rst-versions&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
      <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">span</span> <span class="na">class</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;rst-current-version&quot;</span> <span class="na">data-toggle</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;rst-current-version&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
      <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">span</span> <span class="na">class</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;fa fa-book&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span><span class="ni">&amp;nbsp;</span><span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">span</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
      v: 2.1.x
      <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">span</span> <span class="na">class</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;fa fa-caret-down&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;&lt;/</span><span class="nt">span</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
      <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">span</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
      <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">div</span> <span class="na">class</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;rst-other-versions&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
         <span class="cm">&lt;!-- &quot;Languages&quot; section (``dl`` tag) is not included if the project does not have translations --&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>Languages<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span> <span class="na">class</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;rtd-current-item&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;https://flask.palletsproject.com/en/2.1.x&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>en<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;https://flask.palletsproject.com/es/2.1.x&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>es<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>

         <span class="cm">&lt;!-- &quot;Versions&quot; section (``dl`` tag) is not included if the project is single version --&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>Versions<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/latest/&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>latest<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span> <span class="na">class</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;rtd-current-item&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/2.1.x/&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>2.1.x<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>

         <span class="cm">&lt;!-- &quot;Downloads&quot; section (``dl`` tag) is not included if the project does not have artifacts to download --&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>Downloads<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;//flask.palletsprojects.com/_/downloads/en/2.1.x/pdf/&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>PDF<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
             <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;//flask.palletsprojects.com/_/downloads/en/2.1.x/htmlzip/&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>HTML<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
             <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>

         <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>On Read the Docs<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;//readthedocs.org/projects/flask/&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>Project Home<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;//readthedocs.org/projects/flask/builds/&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>Builds<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;//readthedocs.org/projects/flask/downloads/&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>Downloads<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>

         <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>On GitHub<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;https://github.com/pallets/flask/blob/2.1.x/docs/index.rst&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>View<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;https://github.com/pallets/flask/edit/2.1.x/docs/index.rst&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>Edit<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>

         <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>Search<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dt</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">div</span> <span class="na">style</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;padding: 6px;&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
                  <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">form</span> <span class="na">id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;flyout-search-form&quot;</span> <span class="na">class</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;wy-form&quot;</span> <span class="na">target</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;_blank&quot;</span> <span class="na">action</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;//readthedocs.org/projects/flask/search/&quot;</span> <span class="na">method</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;get&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
                     <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">input</span> <span class="na">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;text&quot;</span> <span class="na">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;q&quot;</span> <span class="na">aria-label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;Search docs&quot;</span> <span class="na">placeholder</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;Search docs&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
                  <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">form</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
               <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">div</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
            <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dd</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">dl</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>

         <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">hr</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>

         <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">span</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> <span class="ni">&amp;middot;</span> <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">span</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">a</span> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&quot;https://docs.readthedocs.io/page/privacy-policy.html&quot;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>Privacy Policy<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">a</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
         <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">small</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
      <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">div</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
   <span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">div</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
<span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">div</span><span class="p">&gt;</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</section>
