<span id="document-reference/environment-variables"></span><section id="environment-variables">
<h3>Environment variables<a class="headerlink" href="#environment-variables" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>All <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-builds"><span class="doc">build processes</span></a> have the following environment variables automatically defined and available for each build step:</p>
<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>Whether the build is running inside Read the Docs.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_PROJECT">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_PROJECT</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_PROJECT" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>The <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-slug"><span class="xref std std-term">slug</span></a> of the project being built. For example, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">my-example-project</span></code>.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_LANGUAGE">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_LANGUAGE</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_LANGUAGE" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>The locale name, or the identifier for the locale, for the project being built.
This value comes from the project‚Äôs configured language.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">en</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">it</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">de_AT</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">es</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pt_BR</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_VERSION">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_VERSION</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_VERSION" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>The <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-slug"><span class="xref std std-term">slug</span></a> of the version being built, such as <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">latest</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">stable</span></code>,
or a branch name like <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">feature-1234</span></code>. For <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-pull-requests"><span class="doc">pull request builds</span></a>,
the value will be the pull request number.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_VERSION_NAME">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_VERSION_NAME</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_VERSION_NAME" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>The verbose name of the version being built, such as <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">latest</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">stable</span></code>,
or a branch name like <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">feature/1234</span></code>.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_VERSION_TYPE">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_VERSION_TYPE</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_VERSION_TYPE" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>The type of the version being built.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">branch</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tag</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">external</span></code> (for <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-pull-requests"><span class="doc">pull request builds</span></a>)</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">unknown</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_VIRTUALENV_PATH">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_VIRTUALENV_PATH</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_VIRTUALENV_PATH" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>Path for the <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-builds"><span class="doc">virtualenv that was created for this build</span></a>.
Only exists for builds using Virtualenv and not Conda.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/home/docs/checkouts/readthedocs.org/user_builds/project/envs/version</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_CANONICAL_URL">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_CANONICAL_URL</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_CANONICAL_URL" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>Canonical base URL for the version that is built.
If the project has configured a <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-custom-domains"><span class="doc">custom domain</span></a> (e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">docs.example.com</span></code>) it will be used in the resulting canonical URL.
Otherwise, your project‚Äôs <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#default-subdomain"><span class="std std-ref">default subdomain</span></a> will be used.</p>
<p>The path for the language and version is appended to the domain, so the final canonical base URLs can look like the following examples:</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://docs.example.com/en/latest/</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://docs.readthedocs.io/ja/stable/</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://example--17.org.readthedocs.build/fr/17/</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_GIT_CLONE_URL">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_GIT_CLONE_URL</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_GIT_CLONE_URL" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>URL for the remote source repository, from which the documentation is cloned.
It could be HTTPS, SSH or any other URL scheme supported by Git.
This is the same URL defined in your Project‚Äôs <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-dashboard"><span class="xref std std-term">dashboard</span></a> in <span class="menuselection">Admin ‚Ä£ Settings ‚Ä£ Repository URL</span>.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">git&#64;github.com:readthedocs/readthedocs.org.git</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_GIT_IDENTIFIER">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_GIT_IDENTIFIER</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_GIT_IDENTIFIER" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>Contains the Git identifier that was <em>checked out</em> from the remote repository URL.
Possible values are either a branch or tag name.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">v1.x</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bugfix/docs-typo</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">feature/signup</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">update-readme</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="std envvar">
<dt class="sig sig-object std" id="envvar-READTHEDOCS_GIT_COMMIT_HASH">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS_GIT_COMMIT_HASH</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#envvar-READTHEDOCS_GIT_COMMIT_HASH" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>Git commit hash identifier checked out from the repository URL.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Example<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1f94e04b7f596c309b7efab4e7630ed78e85a1f1</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-environment-variables"><span class="doc">Understanding environment variables</span></a></dt><dd><p>General information about how environment variables are used in the build process.</p>
</dd>
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/environment-variables"><span class="doc">How to use custom environment variables</span></a></dt><dd><p>Learn how to define your own custom environment variables, in addition to the pre-defined ones.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</section>
<span id="document-security-log"></span><section id="security-logs">
<h3>Security logs<a class="headerlink" href="#security-logs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Security logs allow you to audit what has happened recently in your organization or account.
This feature is quite important for many security compliance programs,
as well as the general peace of mind of knowing what is happening on your account.
We store the IP address and the browser used on each event,
so that you can confirm this access was from the intended person.</p>
<p>Security logs are only visible to organization owners.
You can invite other team members as owners.</p>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-legal/security-policy"><span class="doc">Security policy</span></a></dt><dd><p>General information and reference about how security is handled on Read the Docs.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
<section id="user-security-log">
<h4>User security log<a class="headerlink" href="#user-security-log" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>We store a user security log for the latest 90 days of activity.
This log is useful to validate that no unauthorized events have occurred.</p>
<p>The security log tracks the following events:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Authentication on the dashboard.</p></li>
<li><p>Authentication on documentation pages (<a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-commercial/index"><span class="doc">About Read the Docs for Business</span></a> only).</p></li>
<li><p>When invitations to manage a project are sent, accepted, revoked or declined.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>Authentication failures and successes are both tracked.</p>
<p>Logs are available in <span class="menuselection">&lt;Username dropdown&gt; ‚Ä£ Settings ‚Ä£ Security Log</span>.</p>
</section>
<section id="organization-security-log">
<h4>Organization security log<a class="headerlink" href="#organization-security-log" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>This feature is only available on <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.com/">Read the Docs for Business</a>.</p>
</div>
<p>The length of log storage varies with your plan,
check our <a class="reference external" href="https://about.readthedocs.com/pricing/">pricing page</a> for more details.
Your organization security log is a great place to check periodically to ensure there hasn‚Äôt been unauthorized access to your organization.</p>
<p>Organization logs track the following events:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Authentication on documentation pages from your organization.</p></li>
<li><p>User accesses a documentation page from your organization (<strong>Enterprise plans only</strong>).</p></li>
<li><p>User accesses a documentation‚Äôs downloadable formats (<strong>Enterprise plans only</strong>).</p></li>
<li><p>Invitations to organization teams are sent, revoked or accepted.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>Authentication failures and successes are both tracked.</p>
<p>Logs are available in <span class="menuselection">&lt;Username dropdown&gt; ‚Ä£ Organizations ‚Ä£ &lt;Organization name&gt; ‚Ä£ Settings ‚Ä£ Security Log</span>.</p>
<p>If you have any additional information that you wished the security log was capturing,
you can always reach out to <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-support"><span class="doc">Site support</span></a>.</p>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-security"><span class="doc">Security reports</span></a></dt><dd><p>Security information related to our own platform, personal data treatment, and how to report a security issue.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-server-side-search/index"></span><section id="server-side-search">
<h3>Server side search<a class="headerlink" href="#server-side-search" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Read the Docs provides full-text search across all of the pages of all projects,
this is powered by <a class="reference external" href="https://www.elastic.co/products/elasticsearch">Elasticsearch</a>.
You can search all projects at <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/search/">https://readthedocs.org/search/</a>,
or search only on your project from the <span class="guilabel">Search</span> tab of your project.</p>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-server-side-search/syntax"><span class="doc">Search query syntax</span></a></dt><dd><p>Syntax options for searching Read the Docs projects</p>
</dd>
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-server-side-search/api"><span class="doc">Server side search API</span></a></dt><dd><p>Reference to the Server Side Search API</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
<section id="search-features">
<h4>Search features<a class="headerlink" href="#search-features" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Read the Docs has the following search features:</p>
<dl>
<dt>Search across <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-subprojects"><span class="doc">subprojects</span></a></dt><dd><p>Subprojects allow you to host multiple discrete projects on a single domain.
Every subproject hosted on that same domain is included in the search results of the main project.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Search results land on the exact content you were looking for</dt><dd><p>We index every heading in the document,
allowing you to get search results exactly to the content that you are searching for.
Try this out by searching for <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/search.html?q=%22full-text+search%22">‚Äúfull-text search‚Äù</a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Full control over which results should be listed first</dt><dd><p>Set a custom rank per page,
allowing you to deprecate content, and always show relevant content to your users first.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#search-ranking"><span class="std std-ref">search.ranking</span></a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Search across projects you have access to</dt><dd><p>Search across all the projects you access to in your Dashboard.
<strong>Don‚Äôt remember where you found that document the other day?
No problem, you can search across them all.</strong></p>
<p>You can also specify what projects you want to search
using the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">project:{name}</span></code> syntax, for example:
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/search.html?q=project:docs+project:dev+search">‚Äúproject:docs project:dev search‚Äù</a>.
See <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-server-side-search/syntax"><span class="doc">Search query syntax</span></a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Special query syntax for more specific results</dt><dd><p>We support a full range of search queries.
You can see some examples at <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#special-queries"><span class="std std-ref">Special queries</span></a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Configurable</dt><dd><p>Tweak search results according to your needs using a
<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#search"><span class="std std-ref">configuration file</span></a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Ready to use</dt><dd><p>We override the default search engine of your Sphinx project with ours
to provide you with all these benefits within your project.
We fallback to the built-in search engine from your project if ours doesn‚Äôt return any results,
just in case we missed something üòÑ.</p>
</dd>
<dt>API</dt><dd><p>Integrate our search as you like.
See <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-server-side-search/api"><span class="doc">Server side search API</span></a>.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Analytics</dt><dd><p>Know what your users are searching for.
See <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/search-analytics"><span class="doc">How to use search analytics</span></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<figure class="align-center" id="id1">
<a class="reference internal image-reference" href="_images/search-analytics-demo.png"><img alt="Search analytics demo" src="_images/search-analytics-demo.png" style="width: 50%;" /></a>
<figcaption>
<p><span class="caption-text">Search analytics demo. Read more in <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/search-analytics"><span class="doc">How to use search analytics</span></a>.</span><a class="headerlink" href="#id1" title="Permalink to this image">ÔÉÅ</a></p>
</figcaption>
</figure>
</section>
<section id="search-as-you-type">
<h4>Search as you type<a class="headerlink" href="#search-as-you-type" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs-sphinx-search.readthedocs.io/">readthedocs-sphinx-search</a> is a Sphinx extension that integrates your
documentation more closely with the search implementation of Read the Docs.
It adds a clean and minimal full-page search UI that supports a <strong>search as you type</strong> feature.</p>
<p>To try this feature,
you can press <span class="guilabel">/</span> (forward slash) and start typing or just visit these URLs:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.readthedocs.io/?rtd_search=contributing">https://docs.readthedocs.io/?rtd_search=contributing</a></p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.readthedocs.io/?rtd_search=api/v3/projects/">https://docs.readthedocs.io/?rtd_search=api/v3/projects/</a></p></li>
</ul>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-single-version"></span><section id="single-version-documentation">
<h3>Single version documentation<a class="headerlink" href="#single-version-documentation" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p><em>Single version</em> documentation lets you serve your documentation at the top level of your domain,
for example <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://docs.example.com/</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://example.readthedocs.io/</span></code>.</p>
<p>By default, all documentation served by Read the Docs has a standard path of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/&lt;language&gt;/&lt;version&gt;/</span></code>.
Documentation can be served at <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/</span></code> if you enable the <em>single version</em> option for a project.</p>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>This means you can‚Äôt have translations or multiple versions for your documentation.</p>
</div>
<p>Having a single version of a documentation project can be considered the better choice
in cases where there should only always exist one unambiguous copy of your project.</p>
<p>For example, a research project may wish to <em>only</em> expose readers to their latest list of publications and research data.
Similarly, a <abbr title="Software as a Service">SaaS</abbr> application might only ever have one version live.</p>
<p>You can see a live example of this at <a class="reference external" href="http://www.contribution-guide.org">http://www.contribution-guide.org</a></p>
<section id="enabling">
<h4>Enabling<a class="headerlink" href="#enabling" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>In your project‚Äôs <span class="guilabel">Admin</span> page, you can toggle the <span class="guilabel">Single version</span> option on or off for your project .
Check your <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-dashboard"><span class="xref std std-term">dashboard</span></a> for a list of your projects.</p>
</section>
<section id="effects">
<h4>Effects<a class="headerlink" href="#effects" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Links pointing to the <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-root-URL"><span class="xref std std-term">root URL</span></a> of the project will now point to the proper URL.
For example, if pip was set as a ‚ÄúSingle Version‚Äù project,
then links to its documentation would point to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://pip.readthedocs.io/</span></code>
rather than redirecting to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https://pip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/</span></code>.</p>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>Documentation at <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/&lt;language&gt;/&lt;default_version&gt;/</span></code> will stop working.
Remember to set <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-canonical-urls"><span class="doc">canonical URLs</span></a>
to tell search engines like Google what to index,
and to create <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-user-defined-redirects"><span class="doc">Custom and built-in redirects on Read the Docs</span></a> to avoid broken incoming links.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-science"></span><section id="documentation-in-scientific-and-academic-publishing">
<h3>Documentation in scientific and academic publishing<a class="headerlink" href="#documentation-in-scientific-and-academic-publishing" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>On this page, we explore some of the many tools and practices that <em>software</em> documentation and <em>academic</em> writing share.
If you are working within the field of science or academia,
this page can be used as an introduction.</p>
<p>Documentation and technical writing are broad fields.
Their tools and practices have grown relevant to most scientific activities.
This includes building publications, books, educational resources, interactive data science, resources for data journalism and full-scale websites for research projects and courses.</p>
<p>Here‚Äôs a brief overview of some <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-reference/features"><span class="doc">features</span></a> that people in science and academic writing love about Read the Docs:</p>
<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3" open="open">
<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">
ü™Ñ Easy to use<div class="sd-summary-down docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-down" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M5.22 8.72a.75.75 0 000 1.06l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 001.06 0l6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06L12 14.44 6.28 8.72a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
<div class="sd-summary-up docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-up" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M18.78 15.28a.75.75 0 000-1.06l-6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 101.06 1.06L12 9.56l5.72 5.72a.75.75 0 001.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
</summary><div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">
<p class="sd-card-text">Documentation code doesn‚Äôt have to be written by a programmer. In fact, documentation coding languages are designed and developed so you don‚Äôt have to be a programmer, and there are many writing aids that makes it easy to abstract from code and focus on content.</p>
<p class="sd-card-text">Getting started is also made easy:</p>
<blockquote>
<div><ul class="simple">
<li><p class="sd-card-text">All new to this? Take the official <a class="reference external" href="https://jupyterbook.org/en/stable/start/your-first-book.html" title="(in Python)"><span class="xref std std-doc">Jupyter Book Tutorial</span></a></p></li>
<li><p class="sd-card-text">Curious for practical code? See <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-examples"><span class="doc">Example projects</span></a></p></li>
<li><p class="sd-card-text">Familiar with Sphinx? See <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/jupyter"><span class="doc">How to use Jupyter notebooks in Sphinx</span></a></p></li>
</ul>
</div></blockquote>
</div>
</details><details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">
<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">
üîã Batteries included: Graphs, computations, formulas, maps, diagrams and more<div class="sd-summary-down docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-down" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M5.22 8.72a.75.75 0 000 1.06l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 001.06 0l6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06L12 14.44 6.28 8.72a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
<div class="sd-summary-up docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-up" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M18.78 15.28a.75.75 0 000-1.06l-6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 101.06 1.06L12 9.56l5.72 5.72a.75.75 0 001.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
</summary><div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">
<p class="sd-card-text">Take full advantage of getting all the richness of <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.jupyter.org/en/latest/index.html" title="(in Jupyter Documentation v4.1)"><span class="xref std std-doc">Jupyter Notebook</span></a> combined with Sphinx and the giant ecosystem of extensions for both of these.</p>
<p class="sd-card-text">Here are some examples:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p class="sd-card-text">Use symbols familiar from math and physics, build advanced proofs. See also: <a class="reference external" href="https://sphinx-proof.readthedocs.io/en/latest/syntax.html">sphinx-proof</a></p></li>
<li><p class="sd-card-text">Present results with plots, graphs, images and let users interact directly with your datasets and algorithms. See also: <a class="reference external" href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/tutorials/introductory/usage.html">Matplotlib</a>, <a class="reference external" href="https://jupyterbook.org/en/stable/interactive/interactive.html">Interactive Data Visualizations</a></p></li>
<li><p class="sd-card-text">Graphs, tables etc. are computed when the latest version of your project is built and published as a stand-alone website. All code examples on your website are validated each time you build.</p></li>
</ul>
</div>
</details><details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">
<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">
üìö Bibliographies and external links<div class="sd-summary-down docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-down" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M5.22 8.72a.75.75 0 000 1.06l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 001.06 0l6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06L12 14.44 6.28 8.72a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
<div class="sd-summary-up docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-up" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M18.78 15.28a.75.75 0 000-1.06l-6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 101.06 1.06L12 9.56l5.72 5.72a.75.75 0 001.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
</summary><div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">
<p class="sd-card-text">Maintain bibliography databases directly as code and have external links automatically verified.</p>
<p class="sd-card-text">Using extensions for Sphinx such as the popular <a class="reference external" href="https://sphinxcontrib-bibtex.readthedocs.io/">sphinxcontrib-bibtex</a> extension, you can maintain your bibliography with Sphinx directly or refer to entries <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.bib</span></code> files, as well as generating entire Bibliography sections from those files.</p>
</div>
</details><details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">
<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">
üìú Modern themes and classic PDF outputs<div class="sd-summary-down docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-down" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M5.22 8.72a.75.75 0 000 1.06l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 001.06 0l6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06L12 14.44 6.28 8.72a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
<div class="sd-summary-up docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-up" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M18.78 15.28a.75.75 0 000-1.06l-6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 101.06 1.06L12 9.56l5.72 5.72a.75.75 0 001.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
</summary><div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">
<figure class="align-right">
<img alt="_images/screenshot_rtd_downloads.png" src="_images/screenshot_rtd_downloads.png" />
</figure>
<p class="sd-card-text">Use the latest state-of-the-art themes for web and have PDFs and e-book formats automatically generated.</p>
<p class="sd-card-text">New themes are improving every day, and when you write documentation based on Jupyter Book and Sphinx, you will separate your contents and semantics from your presentation logic. This way, you can keep up with the latest theme updates or try new themes.</p>
<p class="sd-card-text">Another example of the benefits from separating content and presentation logic: Your documentation also transforms into printable books and eBooks.</p>
</div>
</details><details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">
<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">
üìê Widgets, widgets and more widgets<div class="sd-summary-down docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-down" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M5.22 8.72a.75.75 0 000 1.06l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 001.06 0l6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06L12 14.44 6.28 8.72a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
<div class="sd-summary-up docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-up" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M18.78 15.28a.75.75 0 000-1.06l-6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 101.06 1.06L12 9.56l5.72 5.72a.75.75 0 001.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
</summary><div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">
<p class="sd-card-text">Design your science project‚Äôs layout and components with widgets from a rich eco-system of open-source extensions built for many purposes. Special widgets help users display and interact with graphs, maps and more. <a class="reference external" href="https://jupyterbook.org/en/stable/content/components.html" title="(in Python)"><span class="xref std std-doc">Several</span></a> <a class="reference external" href="https://sphinx-gallery.github.io/">extensions</a> are built and invented by the science community.</p>
</div>
</details><details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">
<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">
‚öôÔ∏è Automatic builds<div class="sd-summary-down docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-down" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M5.22 8.72a.75.75 0 000 1.06l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 001.06 0l6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06L12 14.44 6.28 8.72a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
<div class="sd-summary-up docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-up" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M18.78 15.28a.75.75 0 000-1.06l-6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 101.06 1.06L12 9.56l5.72 5.72a.75.75 0 001.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
</summary><div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">
<p class="sd-card-text">Build and publish your project for every change made through Git (GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket etc). Preview changes via pull requests. Receive notifications when something is wrong. How does this work? Have a look at this video:</p>

    <video width="100%" height="300" controls >

    </video>
    </div>

<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">
üí¨ Collaboration and community<div class="sd-summary-down docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-down" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M5.22 8.72a.75.75 0 000 1.06l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 001.06 0l6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06L12 14.44 6.28 8.72a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
<div class="sd-summary-up docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-up" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M18.78 15.28a.75.75 0 000-1.06l-6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 101.06 1.06L12 9.56l5.72 5.72a.75.75 0 001.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
</summary><div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">
<figure class="align-right">
<img alt="_images/screenshot_edit_on_github.png" src="_images/screenshot_edit_on_github.png" />
</figure>
<p class="sd-card-text">Science and academia have a big kinship with software developers: We ‚ù§Ô∏è community. Our solutions and projects become better when we foster inclusivity and active participation. Read the Docs features easy access for readers to suggest changes via your git platform (GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket etc.). But not just any unqualified feedback. Instead, the <em>code</em> and all the tools are available for your community to forge qualified contributions.</p>
<p class="sd-card-text">Your readers can become your co-authors!</p>
<p class="sd-card-text">Discuss changes via pull request and track all changes in your project‚Äôs version history.</p>
<p class="sd-card-text">Using git does not mean that anyone can go and change your code and your published project. The full ownership and permission handling remains in your hands. Project and organization owners on your git platform govern what is released and who has access to approve and build changes.</p>
</div>
</details><details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">
<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">
üîé Full search and analytics<div class="sd-summary-down docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-down" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M5.22 8.72a.75.75 0 000 1.06l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 001.06 0l6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06L12 14.44 6.28 8.72a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
<div class="sd-summary-up docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-up" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M18.78 15.28a.75.75 0 000-1.06l-6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 101.06 1.06L12 9.56l5.72 5.72a.75.75 0 001.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
</summary><div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">
<p class="sd-card-text">Read the Docs comes with a number of features bundled in that you would have to configure if you were hosting documentation elsewhere.</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt>Super-fast text search</dt><dd><p class="sd-card-text">Your documentation is automatically indexed and gets its own search function.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Traffic statistics</dt><dd><p class="sd-card-text">Have full access to your traffic data and have quick access to see which of your pages are most popular.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Search analytics</dt><dd><p class="sd-card-text">What are people searching for and do they get hits? From each search query in your documentation, we collect a neat little statistic that can help to improve the discoverability and relevance of your documentation.</p>
</dd>
<dt>SEO - Don‚Äôt reinvent Search Engine Optimization</dt><dd><p class="sd-card-text">Use built-in SEO best-practices from Sphinx, its themes and Read the Docs hosting. This can give you a good ranking on search engines as a direct outcome of simply writing and publishing your documentation project.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</details><details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">
<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">
üå± Grow your own solutions<div class="sd-summary-down docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-down" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M5.22 8.72a.75.75 0 000 1.06l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 001.06 0l6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06L12 14.44 6.28 8.72a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
<div class="sd-summary-up docutils">
<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-up" viewBox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M18.78 15.28a.75.75 0 000-1.06l-6.25-6.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06 0l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 101.06 1.06L12 9.56l5.72 5.72a.75.75 0 001.06 0z"></path></svg></div>
</summary><div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">
<p class="sd-card-text">The eco-system is open source and makes it accessible for anyone with Python skills to build their own extensions.</p>
</div>

<section id="getting-started-jupyter-book">
<h4>Getting started: Jupyter Book<a class="headerlink" href="#getting-started-jupyter-book" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://jupyterbook.org/en/stable/intro.html" title="(in Python)"><span class="xref std std-doc">Jupyter Book</span></a> on Read the Docs brings you the rich experience of computated <a class="reference external" href="https://jupyter.org/">Jupyter</a> documents built together with a modern documentation tool. The results are beautiful and automatically deployed websites, built with Sphinx and <a class="reference external" href="https://executablebooks.org/en/latest/" title="(in Executable Book Project)"><span class="xref std std-doc">Executable Book</span></a> + all the extensions available in this ecosystem.</p>

<li><p>Data science software documentation</p></li>

<span id="document-config-file/index"></span><section id="configuration-file">
<h2>Configuration file<a class="headerlink" href="#configuration-file" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h2>
<p>In addition to using the admin panel of your project to configure your project,
you can use a configuration file in the root of your project.
The configuration file should be named <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.readthedocs.yaml</span></code>.</p>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Some other variants like <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">readthedocs.yaml</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.readthedocs.yml</span></code>, etc
are deprecated.</p>
</div>
<p>The main advantages of using a configuration file over the web interface are:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Settings are per version rather than per project.</p></li>
<li><p>Settings live in your VCS.</p></li>
<li><p>They enable reproducible build environments over time.</p></li>
<li><p>Some settings are only available using a configuration file</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>Using a configuration file is the recommended way of using Read the Docs.</p>
</div>
<div class="toctree-wrapper compound">
<span id="document-config-file/v2"></span><section id="configuration-file-v2">
<h3>Configuration file v2<a class="headerlink" href="#configuration-file-v2" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Read the Docs supports configuring your documentation builds with a YAML file.
The <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-config-file/index"><span class="doc">configuration file</span></a> must be in the root directory of your project
and be named <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.readthedocs.yaml</span></code>.</p>
<p>All options are applied to the version containing this file.
Below is an example YAML file which shows the most common configuration options:</p>
<div class="sphinx-tabs docutils container">
<div aria-label="Tabbed content" class="closeable" role="tablist"><button aria-controls="panel-0-0-0" aria-selected="true" class="sphinx-tabs-tab" id="tab-0-0-0" name="0-0" role="tab" tabindex="0">Sphinx</button><button aria-controls="panel-0-0-1" aria-selected="false" class="sphinx-tabs-tab" id="tab-0-0-1" name="0-1" role="tab" tabindex="-1">MkDocs</button></div><div aria-labelledby="tab-0-0-0" class="sphinx-tabs-panel" id="panel-0-0-0" name="0-0" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># .readthedocs.yaml</span>
<span class="c1"># Read the Docs configuration file</span>
<span class="c1"># See https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/config-file/v2.html for details</span>

<span class="c1"># Required</span>
<span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="c1"># Set the version of Python and other tools you might need</span>
<span class="nt">build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">os</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">ubuntu-22.04</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">tools</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;3.11&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="c1"># You can also specify other tool versions:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="c1"># nodejs: &quot;19&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="c1"># rust: &quot;1.64&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="c1"># golang: &quot;1.19&quot;</span>

<span class="c1"># Build documentation in the docs/ directory with Sphinx</span>
<span class="nt">sphinx</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">   </span><span class="nt">configuration</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">docs/conf.py</span>

<span class="c1"># If using Sphinx, optionally build your docs in additional formats such as PDF</span>
<span class="c1"># formats:</span>
<span class="c1">#    - pdf</span>

<span class="c1"># Optionally declare the Python requirements required to build your docs</span>
<span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">   </span><span class="nt">install</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">   </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">requirements</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">docs/requirements.txt</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div><div aria-labelledby="tab-0-0-1" class="sphinx-tabs-panel" hidden="true" id="panel-0-0-1" name="0-1" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># .readthedocs.yaml</span>
<span class="c1"># Read the Docs configuration file</span>
<span class="c1"># See https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/config-file/v2.html for details</span>

<span class="c1"># Required</span>
<span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="c1"># Set the version of Python and other tools you might need</span>
<span class="nt">build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">os</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">ubuntu-22.04</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">tools</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;3.11&quot;</span>

<span class="nt">mkdocs</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">configuration</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">mkdocs.yml</span>

<span class="c1"># Optionally declare the Python requirements required to build your docs</span>
<span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">   </span><span class="nt">install</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">   </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">requirements</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">docs/requirements.txt</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div></div>
<section id="supported-settings">
<h4>Supported settings<a class="headerlink" href="#supported-settings" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Read the Docs validates every configuration file.
Any configuration option that isn‚Äôt supported will make the build fail.
This is to avoid typos and provide feedback on invalid configurations.</p>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>When using a v2 configuration file,
the local settings from the web interface are ignored.</p>
</div>

<section id="version">
<h5><a class="toc-backref" href="#id1" role="doc-backlink">version</a><a class="headerlink" href="#version" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Required<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">true</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Example:</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>If you don‚Äôt provide the version, <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-config-file/v1"><span class="doc">v1</span></a> will be used.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="formats">
<h5><a class="toc-backref" href="#id2" role="doc-backlink">formats</a><a class="headerlink" href="#formats" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Additional formats of the documentation to be built,
apart from the default HTML.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Options<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">htmlzip</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pdf</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">epub</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[]</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Example:</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="c1"># Default</span>
<span class="nt">formats</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p p-Indicator">[]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="c1"># Build PDF &amp; ePub</span>
<span class="nt">formats</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">epub</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">pdf</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>You can use the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code> keyword to indicate all formats.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="c1"># Build all formats</span>
<span class="nt">formats</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">all</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>At the moment, only Sphinx supports additional formats.
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pdf</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">epub</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">htmlzip</span></code> output is not yet supported when using MkDocs.</p>
<p>With <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-pull-requests"><span class="doc">builds from pull requests</span></a>, only HTML formats are generated. Other formats are resource intensive and will be built after merging.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="python">
<h5><a class="toc-backref" href="#id3" role="doc-backlink">python</a><a class="headerlink" href="#python" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Configuration of the Python environment to be used.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">install</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">requirements</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">docs/requirements.txt</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">method</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">pip</span>
<span class="w">      </span><span class="nt">path</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">.</span>
<span class="w">      </span><span class="nt">extra_requirements</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">docs</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">method</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">pip</span>
<span class="w">      </span><span class="nt">path</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">another/package</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">system_packages</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">true</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<section id="python-version">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id4" role="doc-backlink">python.version</a><a class="headerlink" href="#python-version" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<div class="admonition warning">

and replaced by <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#build-tools-python"><span class="std std-ref">build.tools.python</span></a>.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#python-version-legacy"><span class="std std-ref">python.version (legacy)</span></a>
for the description of this option.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="python-install">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id5" role="doc-backlink">python.install</a><a class="headerlink" href="#python-install" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>List of installation methods of packages and requirements.
You can have several of the following methods.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[]</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<section id="requirements-file">
<h6 aria-level="7"><a class="toc-backref" href="#id6" role="doc-backlink">Requirements file</a><a class="headerlink" href="#requirements-file" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Install packages from a requirements file.</p>
<p>The path to the requirements file, relative to the root of the project.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Key<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">requirements</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">path</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Required<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">false</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Example:</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">install</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">requirements</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">docs/requirements.txt</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">requirements</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">requirements.txt</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>If you are using a <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#conda"><span class="std std-ref">Conda</span></a> environment to
manage the build, this setting will not have any effect. Instead
add the extra requirements to the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">environment</span></code> file of Conda.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="packages">
<h6 aria-level="7"><a class="toc-backref" href="#id7" role="doc-backlink">Packages</a><a class="headerlink" href="#packages" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Install the project using <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pip</span> <span class="pre">install</span></code> (recommended) or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">python</span> <span class="pre">setup.py</span> <span class="pre">install</span></code> (deprecated).</p>
<p>The path to the package, relative to the root of the project.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Key<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">path</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">path</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Required<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">false</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>The installation method.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Key<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">method</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Options<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pip</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setuptools</span></code> (deprecated)</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pip</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/userguide/dependency_management.html#optional-dependencies">Extra requirements</a> section to install in addition to the <a class="reference external" href="https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/userguide/dependency_management.html#declaring-required-dependency">package dependencies</a>.</p>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>You need to install your project with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pip</span></code> to use <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extra_requirements</span></code>.</p>
</div>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Key<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extra_requirements</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[]</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Example:</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">install</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">method</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">pip</span>
<span class="w">      </span><span class="nt">path</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">.</span>
<span class="w">      </span><span class="nt">extra_requirements</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">docs</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">method</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">pip</span>
<span class="w">      </span><span class="nt">path</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">package</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>With the previous settings, Read the Docs will execute the next commands:</p>
<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span class="prompt1">pip<span class="w"> </span>install<span class="w"> </span>.<span class="o">[</span>docs<span class="o">]</span></span>
<span class="prompt1">python<span class="w"> </span>package/setup.py<span class="w"> </span>install</span>
</pre></div></div></section>
</section>
<section id="python-system-packages">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id8" role="doc-backlink">python.system_packages</a><a class="headerlink" href="#python-system-packages" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Give the virtual environment access to the global site-packages directory.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bool</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">false</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>If you are using a <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#conda"><span class="std std-ref">Conda</span></a> environment
to manage the build, this setting will not have any effect, since
the virtual environment creation is managed by Conda.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>

<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">conda</span><span class="p">:</span>

<p>The path to the Conda <a class="reference external" href="https://conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/tasks/manage-environments.html">environment file</a>, relative to the root of the project.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">

<section id="build">
<h5><a class="toc-backref" href="#id11" role="doc-backlink">build</a><a class="headerlink" href="#build" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Configuration for the documentation build process.
This allows you to specify the base Read the Docs image
used to build the documentation,
and control the versions of several tools:
Python, Node.js, Rust, and Go.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">os</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">ubuntu-22.04</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">tools</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;3.11&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">nodejs</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;18&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">rust</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;1.64&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">golang</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;1.19&quot;</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<section id="build-os">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id12" role="doc-backlink">build.os</a><a class="headerlink" href="#build-os" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>The Docker image used for building the docs.

<p>Arbitrary Docker images are not supported.</p>
</div>
<dl class="field-list simple">

</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Options<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ubuntu-20.04</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ubuntu-22.04</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Required<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
