<section id="build-apt-packages">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id18" role="doc-backlink">build.apt_packages</a><a class="headerlink" href="#build-apt-packages" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>List of <a class="reference external" href="https://packages.ubuntu.com/">APT packages</a> to install.
Our build servers run Ubuntu 18.04, with the default set of package repositories installed.
We don‚Äôt currently support PPA‚Äôs or other custom repositories.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[]</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">apt_packages</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">libclang</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">cmake</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>When possible avoid installing Python packages using apt (<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">python3-numpy</span></code> for example),
<a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/reproducible-builds"><span class="doc">use pip or conda instead</span></a>.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="build-jobs">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id19" role="doc-backlink">build.jobs</a><a class="headerlink" href="#build-jobs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Commands to be run before or after a Read the Docs <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-pre-defined-build-jobs"><span class="xref std std-term">pre-defined build jobs</span></a>.
This allows you to run custom commands at a particular moment in the build process.
See <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-build-customization"><span class="doc">Build process customization</span></a> for more details.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">os</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">ubuntu-22.04</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">tools</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;3.11&quot;</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">jobs</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">pre_create_environment</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">      </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">echo &quot;Command run at &#39;pre_create_environment&#39; step&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">post_build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">      </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">echo &quot;Command run at &#39;post_build&#39; step&quot;</span>
<span class="w">      </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">echo `date`</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Each key under <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.jobs</span></code> must be a list of strings.
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.os</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.tools</span></code> are also required to use <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.jobs</span></code>.</p>
</div>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Allowed keys<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">post_checkout</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pre_system_dependencies</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">post_system_dependencies</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pre_create_environment</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">post_create_environment</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pre_install</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">post_install</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pre_build</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">post_build</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Required<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">false</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{}</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</section>
<section id="build-commands">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id20" role="doc-backlink">build.commands</a><a class="headerlink" href="#build-commands" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Specify a list of commands that Read the Docs will run on the build process.
When <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.commands</span></code> is used, none of the <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-pre-defined-build-jobs"><span class="xref std std-term">pre-defined build jobs</span></a> will be executed.
(see <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-build-customization"><span class="doc">Build process customization</span></a> for more details).
This allows you to run custom commands and control the build process completely.
The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">_readthedocs/html</span></code> directory (relative to the checkout‚Äôs path) will be uploaded and hosted by Read the Docs.</p>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>This feature is in a <em>beta phase</em> and could suffer incompatible changes or even removed completely in the near feature.
It does not yet support some of the Read the Docs‚Äô integrations like the <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-flyout-menu"><span class="xref std std-term">flyout menu</span></a>, search and ads.
However, integrating all of them is part of the plan.
Use it under your own responsibility.</p>
</div>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">os</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">ubuntu-22.04</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">tools</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;3.11&quot;</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">commands</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">pip install pelican</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">pelican --settings docs/pelicanconf.py --output _readthedocs/html/ docs/</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.os</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.tools</span></code> are also required when using <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.commands</span></code>.</p>
</div>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Required<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">false</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[]</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</section>
</section>
<section id="sphinx">
<h5><a class="toc-backref" href="#id21" role="doc-backlink">sphinx</a><a class="headerlink" href="#sphinx" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Configuration for Sphinx documentation
(this is the default documentation type).</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">sphinx</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">builder</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">html</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">configuration</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">conf.py</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">fail_on_warning</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">true</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>If you want to pin Sphinx to a specific version,
use a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">requirements.txt</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">environment.yml</span></code> file
(see <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#requirements-file"><span class="std std-ref">Requirements file</span></a> and  <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#conda-environment"><span class="std std-ref">conda.environment</span></a>).
If you are using a metadata file to describe code dependencies
like <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setup.py</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pyproject.toml</span></code>, or similar,
you can use the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extra_requirements</span></code> option
(see <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#packages"><span class="std std-ref">Packages</span></a>).
This also allows you to override <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#external-dependencies"><span class="std std-ref">the default pinning done by Read the Docs
if your project was created before October 2020</span></a>.</p>
</div>
<section id="sphinx-builder">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id22" role="doc-backlink">sphinx.builder</a><a class="headerlink" href="#sphinx-builder" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>The builder type for the Sphinx documentation.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">string</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Options<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">html</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dirhtml</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">singlehtml</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">html</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">htmldir</span></code> builder option was renamed to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dirhtml</span></code> to use the same name as sphinx.
Configurations using the old name will continue working.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="sphinx-configuration">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id23" role="doc-backlink">sphinx.configuration</a><a class="headerlink" href="#sphinx-configuration" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>The path to the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conf.py</span></code> file, relative to the root of the project.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">path</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">null</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>If the value is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">null</span></code>,
Read the Docs will try to find a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conf.py</span></code> file in your project.</p>
</section>
<section id="sphinx-fail-on-warning">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id24" role="doc-backlink">sphinx.fail_on_warning</a><a class="headerlink" href="#sphinx-fail-on-warning" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Turn warnings into errors
(<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference external" href="https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/man/sphinx-build.html#cmdoption-sphinx-build-W" title="(in Sphinx v7.1.0)"><code class="xref std std-option docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">-W</span></code></a> and <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference external" href="https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/man/sphinx-build.html#cmdoption-sphinx-build-keep-going" title="(in Sphinx v7.1.0)"><code class="xref std std-option docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">--keep-going</span></code></a> options).
This means the build fails if there is a warning and exits with exit status 1.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bool</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">false</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</section>
</section>
<section id="mkdocs">
<h5><a class="toc-backref" href="#id25" role="doc-backlink">mkdocs</a><a class="headerlink" href="#mkdocs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Configuration for MkDocs documentation.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">mkdocs</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">configuration</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">mkdocs.yml</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">fail_on_warning</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">false</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>If you want to pin MkDocs to a specific version,
use a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">requirements.txt</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">environment.yml</span></code> file
(see <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#requirements-file"><span class="std std-ref">Requirements file</span></a> and  <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#conda-environment"><span class="std std-ref">conda.environment</span></a>).
If you are using a metadata file to describe code dependencies
like <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setup.py</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pyproject.toml</span></code>, or similar,
you can use the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extra_requirements</span></code> option
(see <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#packages"><span class="std std-ref">Packages</span></a>).
This also allows you to override <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#external-dependencies"><span class="std std-ref">the default pinning done by Read the Docs
if your project was created before March 2021</span></a>.</p>
</div>
<section id="mkdocs-configuration">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id26" role="doc-backlink">mkdocs.configuration</a><a class="headerlink" href="#mkdocs-configuration" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>The path to the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">mkdocs.yml</span></code> file, relative to the root of the project.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">path</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">null</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>If the value is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">null</span></code>,
Read the Docs will try to find a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">mkdocs.yml</span></code> file in your project.</p>
</section>
<section id="mkdocs-fail-on-warning">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id27" role="doc-backlink">mkdocs.fail_on_warning</a><a class="headerlink" href="#mkdocs-fail-on-warning" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://www.mkdocs.org/user-guide/configuration/#strict">Turn warnings into errors</a>.
This means that the build stops at the first warning and exits with exit status 1.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bool</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">false</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
</section>
</section>
<section id="submodules">
<h5><a class="toc-backref" href="#id28" role="doc-backlink">submodules</a><a class="headerlink" href="#submodules" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>VCS submodules configuration.</p>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Only Git is supported at the moment.</p>
</div>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>You can‚Äôt use <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">include</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">exclude</span></code> settings for submodules at the same time.</p>
</div>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">submodules</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">include</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">one</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">two</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">recursive</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">true</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<section id="submodules-include">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id29" role="doc-backlink">submodules.include</a><a class="headerlink" href="#submodules-include" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>List of submodules to be included.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[]</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>You can use the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code> keyword to include all submodules.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">submodules</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">include</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">all</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
<section id="submodules-exclude">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id30" role="doc-backlink">submodules.exclude</a><a class="headerlink" href="#submodules-exclude" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>List of submodules to be excluded.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[]</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>You can use the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code> keyword to exclude all submodules.
This is the same as <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">include:</span> <span class="pre">[]</span></code>.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">submodules</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">exclude</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">all</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
<section id="submodules-recursive">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id31" role="doc-backlink">submodules.recursive</a><a class="headerlink" href="#submodules-recursive" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Do a recursive clone of the submodules.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bool</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">false</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>This is ignored if there aren‚Äôt submodules to clone.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<section id="search">
<h5><a class="toc-backref" href="#id32" role="doc-backlink">search</a><a class="headerlink" href="#search" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Settings for more control over <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-server-side-search/index"><span class="doc">Server side search</span></a>.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">search</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">ranking</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">api/v1/*</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">-1</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">api/v2/*</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">4</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">ignore</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">404.html</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<section id="search-ranking">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id33" role="doc-backlink">search.ranking</a><a class="headerlink" href="#search-ranking" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Set a custom search rank over pages matching a pattern.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">map</span></code> of patterns to ranks</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{}</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Patterns are matched against the final html pages produced by the build
(you should try to match <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">index.html</span></code>, not <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">docs/index.rst</span></code>).
Patterns can include some special characters:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">*</span></code> matches everything</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">?</span></code> matches any single character</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[seq]</span></code> matches any character in <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">seq</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
<p>The rank can be an integer number between -10 and 10 (inclusive).
Pages with a rank closer to -10 will appear further down the list of results,
and pages with a rank closer to 10 will appear higher in the list of results.
Note that 0 means <em>normal rank</em>, not <em>no rank</em>.</p>
<p>If you are looking to completely ignore a page,
check <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#search-ignore"><span class="std std-ref">search.ignore</span></a>.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">search</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">ranking</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="c1"># Match a single file</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">tutorial.html</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="w">    </span><span class="c1"># Match all files under the api/v1 directory</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">api/v1/*</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">-5</span>

<span class="w">    </span><span class="c1"># Match all files that end with tutorial.html</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="s">&#39;*/tutorial.html&#39;</span><span class="p p-Indicator">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">3</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>The final rank will be the last pattern to match the page.</p>
</div>
<div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>Is better to decrease the rank of pages you want to deprecate,
rather than increasing the rank of the other pages.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="search-ignore">
<h6><a class="toc-backref" href="#id34" role="doc-backlink">search.ignore</a><a class="headerlink" href="#search-ignore" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>List of paths to ignore and exclude from the search index.
Paths matched will not be included in search results.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code> of patterns</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">['search.html',</span> <span class="pre">'search/index.html',</span> <span class="pre">'404.html',</span> <span class="pre">'404/index.html']</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Patterns are matched against the relative path of html files produced by the build
(you should try to match <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">index.html</span></code>, not <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">docs/index.rst</span></code>).
Patterns can include some special characters:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">*</span></code> matches everything</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">?</span></code> matches any single character</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[seq]</span></code> matches any character in <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">seq</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">search</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">   </span><span class="nt">ignore</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="c1"># Ignore a single file in the root of the output directory</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">404.html</span>

<span class="w">     </span><span class="c1"># Ignore all files under the search/ directory</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">search/*</span>

<span class="w">     </span><span class="c1"># Ignore all files named ref.html nested inside one or more sub-folders</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&#39;*/ref.html&#39;</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">search</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">   </span><span class="nt">ignore</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="c1"># Custom files to ignore</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">file.html</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">api/v1/*</span>

<span class="w">     </span><span class="c1"># Defaults</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">search.html</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">search/index.html</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">404.html</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">404/index.html&#39;</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Since Read the Docs fallbacks to the original search engine when no results are found,
you may still see search results from ignored pages.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
</section>
<section id="schema">
<h4>Schema<a class="headerlink" href="#schema" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>You can see the complete schema
<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/blob/main/readthedocs/rtd_tests/fixtures/spec/v2/schema.json">here</a>.
This schema is available at <a class="reference external" href="https://www.schemastore.org/">Schema Store</a>, use it with your favorite editor for validation and autocompletion.</p>
</section>
<section id="legacy-build-specification">
<h4>Legacy <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build</span></code> specification<a class="headerlink" href="#legacy-build-specification" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>The legacy <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build</span></code> specification used a different set of Docker images,
and only allowed you to specify the Python version.
It remains supported for backwards compatibility reasons.
Check out the <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#build"><span class="std std-ref">build</span></a> above
for an alternative method that is more flexible.</p>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">2</span>

<span class="nt">build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">image</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">latest</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">apt_packages</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">libclang</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l l-Scalar l-Scalar-Plain">cmake</span>

<span class="nt">python</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">version</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;3.7&quot;</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>The legacy <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build</span></code> specification also supports
the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">apt_packages</span></code> key described above.</p>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>When using the new specification,
the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.image</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">python.version</span></code> options cannot be used.
Doing so will error the build.</p>
</div>
<section id="build-legacy">
<h5>build (legacy)<a class="headerlink" href="#build-legacy" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<section id="build-image-legacy">
<h6>build.image (legacy)<a class="headerlink" href="#build-image-legacy" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>The Docker image used for building the docs.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">string</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Options<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">stable</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">latest</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">latest</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Each image support different Python versions and has different packages installed,
as defined here:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs-docker-images/tree/releases/5.x">stable</a>:
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2.7</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.5</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.6</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.7</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pypy3.5</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs-docker-images/tree/releases/6.x">latest</a>:
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2.7</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.5</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.6</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.7</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.8</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pypy3.5</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="python-version-legacy">
<h6>python.version (legacy)<a class="headerlink" href="#python-version-legacy" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>The Python version (this depends on <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#build-image-legacy"><span class="std std-ref">build.image (legacy)</span></a>).</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Type<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">string</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Default<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Make sure to use quotes (<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">&quot;</span></code>) to make it a string.
We previously supported using numbers here,
but that approach is deprecated.</p>
</div>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>If you are using a <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#conda"><span class="std std-ref">Conda</span></a> environment to manage
the build, this setting will not have any effect, as the Python version is managed by Conda.</p>
</div>
</section>
</section>
</section>
<section id="migrating-from-v1">
<h4>Migrating from v1<a class="headerlink" href="#migrating-from-v1" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<section id="changes">
<h5>Changes<a class="headerlink" href="#changes" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>The version setting is required. See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#version"><span class="std std-ref">version</span></a>.</p></li>
<li><p>The default value of the <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#formats"><span class="std std-ref">formats</span></a> setting has changed to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">[]</span></code>
and it doesn‚Äôt include the values from the web interface.</p></li>
<li><p>The top setting <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">requirements_file</span></code> was moved to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">python.install</span></code>
and we don‚Äôt try to find a requirements file if the option isn‚Äôt present.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#requirements-file"><span class="std std-ref">Requirements file</span></a>.</p></li>
<li><p>The setting <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conda.file</span></code> was renamed to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conda.environment</span></code>.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#conda-environment"><span class="std std-ref">conda.environment</span></a>.</p></li>
<li><p>The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.image</span></code> setting has been replaced by <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.os</span></code>.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#build-os"><span class="std std-ref">build.os</span></a>.
Alternatively, you can use the legacy <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.image</span></code>
that now has only two options: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">latest</span></code> (default) and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">stable</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p>The settings <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">python.setup_py_install</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">python.pip_install</span></code> were replaced by <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">python.install</span></code>.
And now it accepts a path to the package.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#packages"><span class="std std-ref">Packages</span></a>.</p></li>
<li><p>The setting <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">python.use_system_site_packages</span></code> was renamed to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">python.system_packages</span></code>.
See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#python-system-packages"><span class="std std-ref">python.system_packages</span></a>.</p></li>
<li><p>The build will fail if there are invalid keys (strict mode).</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>Some values from the web interface are no longer respected,
please see <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#migrating-from-the-web-interface"><span class="std std-ref">Migrating from the web interface</span></a> if you have settings there.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="new-settings">
<h5>New settings<a class="headerlink" href="#new-settings" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#sphinx"><span class="std std-ref">sphinx</span></a></p></li>
<li><p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#mkdocs"><span class="std std-ref">mkdocs</span></a></p></li>
<li><p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#submodules"><span class="std std-ref">submodules</span></a></p></li>
<li><p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#python-install"><span class="std std-ref">python.install</span></a></p></li>
<li><p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#search"><span class="std std-ref">search</span></a></p></li>
</ul>
</section>
</section>
<section id="migrating-from-the-web-interface">
<h4>Migrating from the web interface<a class="headerlink" href="#migrating-from-the-web-interface" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>This should be pretty straightforward,
just go to the <span class="guilabel">Admin</span> &gt; <span class="guilabel">Advanced settings</span>,
and find their respective setting in <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#supported-settings"><span class="std std-ref">here</span></a>.</p>
<p>Not all settings in the web interface are per version, but are per project.
These settings aren‚Äôt supported via the configuration file.</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Name</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Repository</span> <span class="pre">URL</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Repository</span> <span class="pre">type</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Language</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Programming</span> <span class="pre">language</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Project</span> <span class="pre">homepage</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Tags</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Single</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Default</span> <span class="pre">branch</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Default</span> <span class="pre">version</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Show</span> <span class="pre">versions</span> <span class="pre">warning</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Privacy</span> <span class="pre">level</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Analytics</span> <span class="pre">code</span></code></p></li>
</ul>
</section>
</section>
</div>
</section>
<span id="document-builds"></span><section id="build-process-overview">
<h2>Build process overview<a class="headerlink" href="#build-process-overview" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h2>
<p>Once a project has been imported and a build is triggered,
Read the Docs executes a set of <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-pre-defined-build-jobs"><span class="xref std std-term">pre-defined jobs</span></a> to build and upload documentation.
This page explains in detail what happens behind the scenes,
and includes an overview of how you can change this process.</p>
<section id="understanding-the-build-process">
<h3>Understanding the build process<a class="headerlink" href="#understanding-the-build-process" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Understanding how your content is built helps with debugging any problems you might hit.
It also gives you the knowledge to customize the build process.</p>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>All the steps are run inside a Docker container, using the image defined in <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#build-os"><span class="std std-ref">build.os</span></a>.
The build has access to all <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-reference/environment-variables"><span class="doc">pre-defined environment variables</span></a> and <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-environment-variables"><span class="doc">custom environment variables</span></a>.</p>
</div>
<p>The build process includes the following jobs:</p>
<dl class="field-list">
<dt class="field-odd">checkout<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>Checks out a project‚Äôs code from the repository URL.
On Read the Docs for Business,
this environment includes the SSH deploy key that gives access to the repository.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">system_dependencies<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>Installs operating system and runtime dependencies.
This includes specific versions of a language (e.g. Python, Node.js, Go, Rust) and also <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">apt</span></code> packages.</p>
<p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#build-tools"><span class="std std-ref">build.tools</span></a> can be used to define a language version,
and <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#build-apt-packages"><span class="std std-ref">build.apt_packages</span></a> to define <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">apt</span></code> packages.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">create_environment<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>Creates a Python environment to install all the dependencies in an isolated and reproducible way.
Depending on what‚Äôs defined by the project,
a virtualenv or a conda environment (<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#conda"><span class="std std-ref">conda</span></a>) will be used.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">install<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>Install <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-build-default-versions"><span class="doc">default and project dependencies</span></a>.
This includes any requirements you have configured in <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#requirements-file"><span class="std std-ref">Requirements file</span></a>.</p>
<p>If the project has extra Python requirements,
<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#python-install"><span class="std std-ref">python.install</span></a> can be used to specify them.</p>
<div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>We strongly recommend <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/reproducible-builds"><span class="doc">pinning all the versions</span></a> required to build the documentation to avoid unexpected build errors.</p>
</div>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">build<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>Runs the main command to build the documentation for each of the formats declared (<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#formats"><span class="std std-ref">formats</span></a>).
It will use Sphinx (<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#sphinx"><span class="std std-ref">sphinx</span></a>) or MkDocs (<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#mkdocs"><span class="std std-ref">mkdocs</span></a>) depending on the project.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">upload<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>Once the build process finishes successfully,
the resulting artifacts are uploaded to our servers.
Our <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-reference/cdn"><span class="doc">CDN</span></a> is then purged so your docs are <em>always up to date</em>.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<p>If you require additional build steps or customization,
it‚Äôs possible to run user-defined commands and <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-build-customization"><span class="doc">customize the build process</span></a>.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="cancelling-builds">
<h3>Cancelling builds<a class="headerlink" href="#cancelling-builds" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>There may be situations where you want to cancel a running build.
Cancelling builds allows your team to speed up review times and also help us reduce server costs and our environmental footprint.</p>
<p>A couple common reasons you might want to cancel builds are:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>the build has an external dependency that hasn‚Äôt been updated</p></li>
<li><p>there were no changes on the documentation files</p></li>
</ul>
<p>For these scenarios,
Read the Docs supports three different mechanisms to cancel a running build:</p>
<dl class="field-list">
<dt class="field-odd">Manually<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>Once a build was triggered,
project administrators can go to the build detail page
and click <span class="guilabel">Cancel build</span>.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Automatically<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>When Read the Docs detects a push to a version that is already building,
it cancels the running build and starts a new build using the latest commit.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Programatically<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>You can use user-defined commands on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.jobs</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">build.commands</span></code> (see <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-build-customization"><span class="doc">Build process customization</span></a>)
to check for your own cancellation condition and then return exit code <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">183</span></code> to cancel a build.
You can exit with the code <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code> to continue running the build.</p>
<p>When this happens, Read the Docs will notify your Git platform (GitHub/GitLab) that the build succeeded (‚úÖ),
so the pull request doesn‚Äôt have any failing checks.</p>
<div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>Take a look at <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#cancel-build-based-on-a-condition"><span class="std std-ref">Cancel build based on a condition</span></a> section for some examples.</p>
</div>
</dd>
</dl>
</section>
<section id="build-resources">
<h3>Build resources<a class="headerlink" href="#build-resources" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Every build has limited resources assigned to it.
Generally, Read the Docs for Business users get double the build resources,
with the option to increase that.</p>
<p>Our build limits are:</p>
<div class="sphinx-tabs docutils container">
<div aria-label="Tabbed content" class="closeable" role="tablist"><button aria-controls="panel-0-0-0" aria-selected="true" class="sphinx-tabs-tab" id="tab-0-0-0" name="0-0" role="tab" tabindex="0">Read the Docs for Business</button><button aria-controls="panel-0-0-1" aria-selected="false" class="sphinx-tabs-tab" id="tab-0-0-1" name="0-1" role="tab" tabindex="-1">Read the Docs Community</button></div><div aria-labelledby="tab-0-0-0" class="sphinx-tabs-panel" id="panel-0-0-0" name="0-0" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><ul class="simple">
<li><p>30 minutes build time</p></li>
<li><p>7GB of memory</p></li>
<li><p>Concurrent builds vary based on your pricing plan</p></li>
</ul>
<p>If you are having trouble with your documentation builds,
you can reach our support at <a class="reference external" href="mailto:support&#37;&#52;&#48;readthedocs&#46;com">support<span>&#64;</span>readthedocs<span>&#46;</span>com</a>.</p>
</div><div aria-labelledby="tab-0-0-1" class="sphinx-tabs-panel" hidden="true" id="panel-0-0-1" name="0-1" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><ul class="simple">
<li><p>15 minutes build time</p></li>
