<section id="building-and-publishing-your-project">
<h3><a class="toc-backref" href="#id2" role="doc-backlink">Building and publishing your project</a><a class="headerlink" href="#building-and-publishing-your-project" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<section id="why-does-my-project-have-status-failing">
<span id="my-project-isn-t-building-correctly"></span><h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id3" role="doc-backlink">Why does my project have status ‚Äúfailing‚Äù?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#why-does-my-project-have-status-failing" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Projects have the status ‚Äúfailing‚Äù because something in the build process has failed.
This can be because the project is not correctly configured,
because the contents of the Git repository cannot be built,
or in the most rare cases because a system that Read the Docs connects to is not working.</p>
<p>First, you should check out the Builds tab of your project.
By clicking on the failing step,
you will be able to see details that can lead to resolutions to your build error.</p>
<p>If the solution is not self-evident,
you can use an important word or message from the error to search for a solution.</p>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/build-troubleshooting"><span class="doc">Troubleshooting build errors</span></a></dt><dd><p>Common errors and solutions for build failures.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Other FAQ entries</dt><dd><ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#how-do-i-add-additional-software-dependencies-for-my-documentation"><span class="std std-ref">How do I add additional software dependencies for my documentation?</span></a></p></li>
<li><p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#why-do-i-get-import-errors-from-libraries-depending-on-c-modules"><span class="std std-ref">Why do I get import errors from libraries depending on C modules?</span></a></p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</section>
<section id="why-does-my-project-have-status-passed-but-i-get-a-404-page">
<span id="help-my-build-passed-but-my-documentation-page-is-404-not-found"></span><h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id4" role="doc-backlink">Why does my project have status ‚Äúpassed‚Äù but I get a 404 page?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#why-does-my-project-have-status-passed-but-i-get-a-404-page" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>This often happens because you don‚Äôt have an <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">index.html</span></code> file being generated.</p>
<p>Make sure you have one of the following files at the top level of your documentation source:</p>
<blockquote>
<div><ul class="simple">
<li><p><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">index.rst</span></code> (Sphinx)</p></li>
<li><p><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">index.md</span></code> (MkDocs or Sphinx with MyST)</p></li>
</ul>
</div></blockquote>
<div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>To test if your docs actually built correctly,
you can navigate to a specific page that you know is part of the documentation build,
for example <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/en/latest/README.html</span></code>.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="why-do-i-get-import-errors-from-libraries-depending-on-c-modules">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id5" role="doc-backlink">Why do I get import errors from libraries depending on C modules?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#why-do-i-get-import-errors-from-libraries-depending-on-c-modules" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Another use case for this is when you have a module with a C extension.</p>
</div>
<p>This happens because the build system does not have the dependencies for
building your project, such as C libraries needed by some Python packages (e.g.
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">libevent</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">mysql</span></code>). For libraries that cannot be <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#build-apt-packages"><span class="std std-ref">installed via apt</span></a> in the builder there is another way to
successfully build the documentation despite missing dependencies.</p>
<p>With Sphinx you can use the built-in <a class="reference external" href="http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/extensions/autodoc.html#confval-autodoc_mock_imports">autodoc_mock_imports</a> for mocking. If
such libraries are installed via <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setup.py</span></code>, you also will need to remove all
the C-dependent libraries from your <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">install_requires</span></code> in the RTD environment.</p>
</section>
<section id="where-do-i-need-to-put-my-docs-for-rtd-to-find-it">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id6" role="doc-backlink">Where do I need to put my docs for RTD to find it?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#where-do-i-need-to-put-my-docs-for-rtd-to-find-it" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Read the Docs will crawl your project looking for a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conf.py</span></code>. Where it finds the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conf.py</span></code>,
it will run <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sphinx-build</span></code> in that directory.
So as long as you only have one set of sphinx documentation in your project, it should Just Work.</p>
<p>You can specify an exact path to your documentation using a Read the Docs <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-config-file/index"><span class="doc">Configuration file</span></a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="how-can-i-avoid-search-results-having-a-deprecated-version-of-my-docs">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id7" role="doc-backlink">How can I avoid search results having a deprecated version of my docs?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#how-can-i-avoid-search-results-having-a-deprecated-version-of-my-docs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>If readers search something related to your docs in Google, it will probably return the most relevant version of your documentation.
It may happen that this version is already deprecated and you want to stop Google indexing it as a result,
and start suggesting the latest (or newer) one.</p>
<p>To accomplish this, you can add a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">robots.txt</span></code> file to your documentation‚Äôs root so it ends up served at the root URL of your project
(for example, <a class="reference external" href="https://yourproject.readthedocs.io/robots.txt">https://yourproject.readthedocs.io/robots.txt</a>).
We have documented how to set this up in <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-reference/robots"><span class="doc">robots.txt support</span></a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="how-do-i-change-the-version-slug-of-my-project">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id8" role="doc-backlink">How do I change the version slug of my project?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#how-do-i-change-the-version-slug-of-my-project" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>We don‚Äôt support allowing folks to change the slug for their versions.
But you can rename the branch/tag to achieve this.
If that isn‚Äôt enough,
you can request the change sending an email to <a class="reference external" href="mailto:support&#37;&#52;&#48;readthedocs&#46;org">support<span>&#64;</span>readthedocs<span>&#46;</span>org</a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="what-commit-of-read-the-docs-is-in-production">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id9" role="doc-backlink">What commit of Read the Docs is in production?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#what-commit-of-read-the-docs-is-in-production" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>We deploy readthedocs.org from the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">rel</span></code> branch in our GitHub repository.
You can see the latest commits that have been deployed by looking on GitHub: <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/commits/rel">https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/commits/rel</a></p>
<p>We also keep an up-to-date <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-changelog"><span class="doc">changelog</span></a>.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="additional-features-and-configuration">
<h3><a class="toc-backref" href="#id10" role="doc-backlink">Additional features and configuration</a><a class="headerlink" href="#additional-features-and-configuration" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<section id="how-do-i-add-additional-software-dependencies-for-my-documentation">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id11" role="doc-backlink">How do I add additional software dependencies for my documentation?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#how-do-i-add-additional-software-dependencies-for-my-documentation" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>For most Python dependencies,
you can can specify a requirements file which details your dependencies.
You can also set your project documentation to install your Python project itself as a dependency.</p>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-builds"><span class="doc">Build process overview</span></a></dt><dd><p>An overview of the build process.</p>
</dd>
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/reproducible-builds"><span class="doc">How to create reproducible builds</span></a></dt><dd><p>General information about adding dependencies and best-practices for maintaining them.</p>
</dd>
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-build-customization"><span class="doc">Build process customization</span></a></dt><dd><p>How to customize your builds, for example if you need to build with different tools from Sphinx or
if you need to add additional packages for the Ubuntu-based builder.</p>
</dd>
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-config-file/v2"><span class="doc">Configuration file v2</span></a></dt><dd><p>Reference for the main configuration file, <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">readthedocs.yaml</span></code></p>
</dd>
<dt><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#build-apt-packages"><span class="std std-ref">build.apt_packages</span></a></dt><dd><p>Reference for adding Debian packages with apt for the Ubuntu-based builders</p>
</dd>
<dt>Other FAQ entries</dt><dd><ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#how-do-i-add-additional-software-dependencies-for-my-documentation"><span class="std std-ref">How do I add additional software dependencies for my documentation?</span></a></p></li>
<li><p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#why-do-i-get-import-errors-from-libraries-depending-on-c-modules"><span class="std std-ref">Why do I get import errors from libraries depending on C modules?</span></a></p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</section>
<section id="can-i-have-access-to-additional-features-or-settings">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id12" role="doc-backlink">Can I have access to additional features or settings?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#can-i-have-access-to-additional-features-or-settings" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>If this is just a dependency issue,
see <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#how-do-i-add-additional-software-dependencies-for-my-documentation"><span class="std std-ref">How do I add additional software dependencies for my documentation?</span></a>.</p>
<p>Read the Docs offers some settings (feature flags) which can be used for a variety of purposes.
To enable these settings,
please send an email to <a class="reference external" href="mailto:support&#37;&#52;&#48;readthedocs&#46;org">support<span>&#64;</span>readthedocs<span>&#46;</span>org</a> and we will change the settings for the project.</p>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-feature-flags"><span class="doc">Feature flags</span></a></dt><dd><p>Reference of all Feature Flags that can be requested.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</section>
<section id="how-do-i-change-behavior-when-building-with-read-the-docs">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id13" role="doc-backlink">How do I change behavior when building with Read the Docs?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#how-do-i-change-behavior-when-building-with-read-the-docs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>When RTD builds your project, it sets the <span class="target" id="index-0"></span><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#envvar-READTHEDOCS"><code class="xref std std-envvar docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS</span></code></a> environment
variable to the string <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">'True'</span></code>. So within your Sphinx <code class="file docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conf.py</span></code> file, you
can vary the behavior based on this. For example:</p>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">os</span>

<span class="n">on_rtd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">environ</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;READTHEDOCS&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">&quot;True&quot;</span>
<span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">on_rtd</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">html_theme</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">&quot;default&quot;</span>
<span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">html_theme</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">&quot;nature&quot;</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>The <span class="target" id="index-1"></span><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#envvar-READTHEDOCS"><code class="xref std std-envvar docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">READTHEDOCS</span></code></a> variable is also available in the Sphinx build
environment, and will be set to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code> when building on RTD:</p>
<div class="highlight-jinja notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="cp">{%</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nv">READTHEDOCS</span> <span class="cp">%}</span>
<span class="x">Woo</span>
<span class="cp">{%</span> <span class="k">endif</span> <span class="cp">%}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</section>
<section id="i-want-comments-in-my-docs">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id14" role="doc-backlink">I want comments in my docs</a><a class="headerlink" href="#i-want-comments-in-my-docs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>RTD doesn‚Äôt have explicit support for this.
That said, a tool like <a class="reference external" href="https://disqus.com/">Disqus</a> (and the <a class="reference external" href="https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sphinxcontrib-disqus">sphinxcontrib-disqus</a> plugin) can be used for this purpose on RTD.</p>
</section>
<section id="can-i-remove-advertising-from-my-documentation">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id15" role="doc-backlink">Can I remove advertising from my documentation?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#can-i-remove-advertising-from-my-documentation" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Yes. See <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#opting-out"><span class="std std-ref">Opting out of advertising</span></a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="how-do-i-change-my-project-slug-the-url-your-docs-are-served-at">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id16" role="doc-backlink">How do I change my project slug (the URL your docs are served at)?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#how-do-i-change-my-project-slug-the-url-your-docs-are-served-at" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>We don‚Äôt support allowing folks to change the slug for their project.
You can update the name which is shown on the site,
but not the actual URL that documentation is served.</p>
<p>The main reason for this is that all existing URLs to the content will break.
You can delete and re-create the project with the proper name to get a new slug,
but you really shouldn‚Äôt do this if you have existing inbound links,
as it <a class="reference external" href="http://www.w3.org/Provider/Style/URI.html">breaks the internet</a>.</p>
<p>If that isn‚Äôt enough,
you can request the change sending an email to <a class="reference external" href="mailto:support&#37;&#52;&#48;readthedocs&#46;org">support<span>&#64;</span>readthedocs<span>&#46;</span>org</a>.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="big-projects">
<h3><a class="toc-backref" href="#id17" role="doc-backlink">Big projects</a><a class="headerlink" href="#big-projects" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<section id="how-do-i-host-multiple-projects-on-one-custom-domain">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id18" role="doc-backlink">How do I host multiple projects on one custom domain?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#how-do-i-host-multiple-projects-on-one-custom-domain" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>We support the concept of subprojects, which allows multiple projects to share a
single domain. If you add a subproject to a project, that documentation will
be served under the parent project‚Äôs subdomain or custom domain.</p>
<p>For example,
Kombu is a subproject of Celery,
so you can access it on the <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">celery.readthedocs.io</span></code> domain:</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://celery.readthedocs.io/projects/kombu/en/latest/">https://celery.readthedocs.io/projects/kombu/en/latest/</a></p>
<p>This also works the same for custom domains:</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="http://docs..org/projects/kombu/en/latest/">http://docs..org/projects/kombu/en/latest/</a></p>
<p>You can add subprojects in the project admin dashboard.</p>
<p>For details on custom domains, see our documentation on <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-custom-domains"><span class="doc">Custom domains</span></a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="how-do-i-support-multiple-languages-of-documentation">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id19" role="doc-backlink">How do I support multiple languages of documentation?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#how-do-i-support-multiple-languages-of-documentation" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Read the Docs supports multiple languages.
See the section on <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-localization"><span class="doc">Localization of documentation</span></a>.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="sphinx">
<h3><a class="toc-backref" href="#id20" role="doc-backlink">Sphinx</a><a class="headerlink" href="#sphinx" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<section id="i-want-to-use-the-blue-default-sphinx-theme">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id21" role="doc-backlink">I want to use the Blue/Default Sphinx theme</a><a class="headerlink" href="#i-want-to-use-the-blue-default-sphinx-theme" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>We think that our theme is badass,
and better than the default for many reasons.
Some people don‚Äôt like change though üòÑ,
so there is a hack that will let you keep using the default theme.
If you set the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">html_style</span></code> variable in your <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conf.py</span></code>,
it should default to using the default theme.
The value of this doesn‚Äôt matter, and can be set to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/default.css</span></code> for default behavior.</p>
</section>
<section id="i-want-to-use-the-read-the-docs-theme-locally">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id22" role="doc-backlink">I want to use the Read the Docs theme locally</a><a class="headerlink" href="#i-want-to-use-the-read-the-docs-theme-locally" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Read the Docs automatically applies the sphinx-rtd-theme to projects that do not have a defined theme.
If you build a Sphinx project locally,
you should specify that you are using sphinx-rtd-theme.</p>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt><a class="reference external" href="https://sphinx-rtd-theme.readthedocs.io/en/stable/installing.html">sphinx-rtd-theme documentation</a></dt><dd><p>See the official documentation for instructions to enable it in your Sphinx theme.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</section>
<section id="image-scaling-doesn-t-work-in-my-documentation">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id23" role="doc-backlink">Image scaling doesn‚Äôt work in my documentation</a><a class="headerlink" href="#image-scaling-doesn-t-work-in-my-documentation" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Image scaling in docutils depends on PIL. PIL is installed in the system that RTD runs on. However, if you are using the virtualenv building option, you will likely need to include PIL in your requirements for your project.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="python">
<h3><a class="toc-backref" href="#id24" role="doc-backlink">Python</a><a class="headerlink" href="#python" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<section id="can-i-document-a-python-package-that-is-not-at-the-root-of-my-repository">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id25" role="doc-backlink">Can I document a Python package that is not at the root of my repository?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#can-i-document-a-python-package-that-is-not-at-the-root-of-my-repository" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Yes. The most convenient way to access a Python package for example via
<a class="reference external" href="http://sphinx-doc.org/ext/autodoc.html">Sphinx‚Äôs autoapi</a> in your documentation is to use the <em>Install your project
inside a virtualenv using setup.py install</em> option in the admin panel of
your project. However this assumes that your <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setup.py</span></code> is in the root of
your repository.</p>
<p>If you want to place your package in a different directory or have multiple
Python packages in the same project, then create a pip requirements file. You
can specify the relative path to your package inside the file.
For example you want to keep your Python package in the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">src/python</span></code>
directory, then create a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">requirements.txt</span></code> file with the
following contents:</p>
<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">src</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">python</span><span class="o">/</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Please note that the path must be relative to the working directory where <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pip</span></code> is launched,
rather than the directory where the requirements file is located.
Therefore, even if you want to move the requirements file to a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">requirements/</span></code> directory,
the example path above would work.</p>
<p>You can customize the path to your requirements file and any other installed dependency
using a Read the Docs <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-config-file/index"><span class="doc">Configuration file</span></a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="does-read-the-docs-work-well-with-legible-docstrings">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id26" role="doc-backlink">Does Read the Docs work well with ‚Äúlegible‚Äù docstrings?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#does-read-the-docs-work-well-with-legible-docstrings" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Yes. One criticism of Sphinx is that its annotated docstrings are too
dense and difficult for humans to read. In response, many projects
have adopted customized docstring styles that are simultaneously
informative and legible. The
<a class="reference external" href="https://numpydoc.readthedocs.io/en/latest/format.html#docstring-standard">NumPy</a>
and
<a class="reference external" href="https://google.github.io/styleguide/pyguide.html#38-comments-and-docstrings">Google</a>
styles are two popular docstring formats.  Fortunately, the default
Read the Docs theme handles both formats just fine, provided
your <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conf.py</span></code> specifies an appropriate Sphinx extension that
knows how to convert your customized docstrings.  Two such extensions
are <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/numpy/numpydoc">numpydoc</a> and
<a class="reference external" href="http://sphinxcontrib-napoleon.readthedocs.io">napoleon</a>. Only
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">napoleon</span></code> is able to handle both docstring formats. Its default
output more closely matches the format of standard Sphinx annotations,
and as a result, it tends to look a bit better with the default theme.</p>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>To use these extensions you need to specify the dependencies on your project
by following this <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-guides/reproducible-builds"><span class="doc">guide</span></a>.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="i-need-to-install-a-package-in-a-environment-with-pinned-versions">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id27" role="doc-backlink">I need to install a package in a environment with pinned versions</a><a class="headerlink" href="#i-need-to-install-a-package-in-a-environment-with-pinned-versions" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>To ensure proper installation of a Python package, the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pip</span></code> <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#python-install"><span class="std std-ref">install method</span></a> will automatically upgrade every dependency to its most recent version in case they aren‚Äôt:term:<code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pinned</span></code> by the package definition.
If instead you‚Äôd like to pin your dependencies outside the package, you can add this line to your requirements or environment file (if you are using Conda).</p>
<p>In your <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">requirements.txt</span></code> file:</p>
<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># path to the directory containing setup.py relative to the project root</span>
<span class="o">-</span><span class="n">e</span> <span class="o">.</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>In your Conda environment file (<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">environment.yml</span></code>):</p>
<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># path to the directory containing setup.py relative to the environment file</span>
<span class="o">-</span><span class="n">e</span> <span class="o">..</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</section>
<section id="can-i-use-anaconda-project-and-anaconda-project-yml">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id28" role="doc-backlink">Can I use Anaconda Project and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">anaconda-project.yml</span></code>?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#can-i-use-anaconda-project-and-anaconda-project-yml" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Yes. With <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">anaconda-project&gt;=0.8.4</span></code> you can use the <a class="reference external" href="https://anaconda-project.readthedocs.io/en/latest/">Anaconda Project</a> configuration
file <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">anaconda-project.yaml</span></code> (or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">anaconda-project.yml</span></code>) directly in place of a
Conda environment file by using <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dependencies:</span></code> as an alias for <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">packages:</span></code>.</p>
<p>I.e., your <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">anaconda-project.yaml</span></code> file can be used as a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conda.environment</span></code> config
in the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.readthedocs.yaml</span></code> config file if it contains:</p>
<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dependencies</span><span class="p">:</span>
  <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">python</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">3.9</span>
  <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">scipy</span>
  <span class="o">...</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</section>
</section>
<section id="other-documentation-frameworks">
<h3><a class="toc-backref" href="#id29" role="doc-backlink">Other documentation frameworks</a><a class="headerlink" href="#other-documentation-frameworks" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<section id="how-can-i-deploy-jupyter-book-projects-on-read-the-docs">
<h4><a class="toc-backref" href="#id30" role="doc-backlink">How can I deploy Jupyter Book projects on Read the Docs?</a><a class="headerlink" href="#how-can-i-deploy-jupyter-book-projects-on-read-the-docs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>According to <a class="reference external" href="https://jupyterbook.org/">its own documentation</a>,</p>
<blockquote>
<div><p>Jupyter Book is an open source project for building beautiful,
publication-quality books and documents from computational material.</p>
</div></blockquote>
<p>Even though <a class="reference external" href="https://jupyterbook.org/explain/sphinx.html#jupyter-book-is-a-distribution-of-sphinx">Jupyter Book leverages Sphinx ‚Äúfor almost everything that it
does‚Äù</a>,
it purposedly hides Sphinx <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conf.py</span></code> files from the user,
and instead generates them on the fly from its declarative <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">_config.yml</span></code>.
As a result, you need to follow some extra steps
to make Jupyter Book work on Read the Docs.</p>
<p>As described in <a class="reference external" href="https://jupyterbook.org/en/stable/publish/readthedocs.html" title="(in Python)"><span class="xref std std-doc">the official documentation</span></a>,
you can manually convert your Jupyter Book project to Sphinx with the following configuration:</p>
<div class="literal-block-wrapper docutils container" id="id1">
<div class="code-block-caption"><span class="caption-text">.readthedocs.yaml</span><a class="headerlink" href="#id1" title="Permalink to this code">ÔÉÅ</a></div>
<div class="highlight-yaml notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">     </span><span class="nt">jobs</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">         </span><span class="nt">pre_build</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="w">         </span><span class="c1"># Generate the Sphinx configuration for this Jupyter Book so it builds.</span>
<span class="w">         </span><span class="p p-Indicator">-</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s">&quot;jupyter-book</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">config</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">sphinx</span><span class="nv"> </span><span class="s">docs/&quot;</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-api/index"></span><section id="public-api">
<h2>Public API<a class="headerlink" href="#public-api" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h2>
<p>This section of the documentation details the public API
usable to get details of projects, builds, versions and other details
from Read the Docs.</p>
<div class="toctree-wrapper compound">
<span id="document-api/v3"></span><section id="api-v3">
<h3>API v3<a class="headerlink" href="#api-v3" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>The Read the Docs API uses <abbr title="Representational State Transfer">REST</abbr>.
JSON is returned by all API responses including errors
and HTTP response status codes are to designate success and failure.</p>

<section id="authentication-and-authorization">
<h4>Authentication and authorization<a class="headerlink" href="#authentication-and-authorization" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Requests to the Read the Docs public API are for public and private information.
All endpoints require authentication.</p>
<section id="token">
<h5>Token<a class="headerlink" href="#token" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Authorization</span></code> HTTP header can be specified with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Token</span> <span class="pre">&lt;your-access-token&gt;</span></code>
to authenticate as a user and have the same permissions that the user itself.</p>
<div class="sphinx-tabs docutils container">
<div aria-label="Tabbed content" class="closeable" role="tablist"><button aria-controls="panel-0-0-0" aria-selected="true" class="sphinx-tabs-tab" id="tab-0-0-0" name="0-0" role="tab" tabindex="0">Read the Docs Community</button><button aria-controls="panel-0-0-1" aria-selected="false" class="sphinx-tabs-tab" id="tab-0-0-1" name="0-1" role="tab" tabindex="-1">Read the Docs for Business</button></div><div aria-labelledby="tab-0-0-0" class="sphinx-tabs-panel" id="panel-0-0-0" name="0-0" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>On Read the Docs Community, you will find your access Token under
<a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/accounts/tokens/">your profile settings</a>.</p>
</div>
</div><div aria-labelledby="tab-0-0-1" class="sphinx-tabs-panel" hidden="true" id="panel-0-0-1" name="0-1" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>On Read the Docs for Business, you will find your access Token under
<a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.com/accounts/tokens/">your profile settings</a>.</p>
</div>
</div></div>
</section>
<section id="session">
<h5>Session<a class="headerlink" href="#session" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<div class="admonition warning">
<p class="admonition-title">Warning</p>
<p>Authentication via session is not enabled yet.</p>
</div>
<p>Session authentication is allowed on very specific endpoints,
to allow hitting the API when reading documentation.</p>
<p>When a user is trying to authenticate via session,
<abbr title="Cross-site request forgery">CSRF</abbr> check is performed.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="resources">
<h4>Resources<a class="headerlink" href="#resources" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>This section shows all the resources that are currently available in APIv3.
There are some URL attributes that applies to all of these resources:</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">?fields=<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>Specify which fields are going to be returned in the response.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">?omit=<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>Specify which fields are going to be omitted from the response.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">?expand=<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>Some resources allow to expand/add extra fields on their responses (see <a class="reference external" href="#project-details">Project details</a> for example).</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="sphinx-tabs docutils container">
<div aria-label="Tabbed content" class="closeable" role="tablist"><button aria-controls="panel-1-1-0" aria-selected="true" class="sphinx-tabs-tab" id="tab-1-1-0" name="1-0" role="tab" tabindex="0">Read the Docs Community</button><button aria-controls="panel-1-1-1" aria-selected="false" class="sphinx-tabs-tab" id="tab-1-1-1" name="1-1" role="tab" tabindex="-1">Read the Docs for Business</button></div><div aria-labelledby="tab-1-1-0" class="sphinx-tabs-panel" id="panel-1-1-0" name="1-0" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>You can browse the full API by accessing its root URL: <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/">https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/</a></p>
</div>
</div><div aria-labelledby="tab-1-1-1" class="sphinx-tabs-panel" hidden="true" id="panel-1-1-1" name="1-1" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>You can browse the full API by accessing its root URL: <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.com/api/v3/">https://readthedocs.com/api/v3/</a></p>
</div>
</div></div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>If you are using <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-commercial/index"><span class="doc">Read the Docs for Business</span></a> take into account that you will need to replace
<a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/">https://readthedocs.org/</a> by <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.com/">https://readthedocs.com/</a> in all the URLs used in the following examples.</p>
</div>
<section id="projects">
<h5>Projects<a class="headerlink" href="#projects" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<section id="projects-list">
<h6>Projects list<a class="headerlink" href="#projects-list" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<dl class="http get">
<dt class="sig sig-object http" id="get--api-v3-projects-">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">GET</span> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">/api/v3/projects/</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#get--api-v3-projects-" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>Retrieve a list of all the projects for the current logged in user.</p>
<p><strong>Example request</strong>:</p>
<div class="sphinx-tabs docutils container">
<div aria-label="Tabbed content" class="closeable" role="tablist"><button aria-controls="panel-2-QmFzaA==" aria-selected="true" class="sphinx-tabs-tab code-tab group-tab" id="tab-2-QmFzaA==" name="QmFzaA==" role="tab" tabindex="0">Bash</button><button aria-controls="panel-2-UHl0aG9u" aria-selected="false" class="sphinx-tabs-tab code-tab group-tab" id="tab-2-UHl0aG9u" name="UHl0aG9u" role="tab" tabindex="-1">Python</button></div><div aria-labelledby="tab-2-QmFzaA==" class="sphinx-tabs-panel code-tab group-tab" id="panel-2-QmFzaA==" name="QmFzaA==" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-bash notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>$<span class="w"> </span>curl<span class="w"> </span>-H<span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Authorization: Token &lt;token&gt;&quot;</span><span class="w"> </span>https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/projects/
</pre></div>
</div>
</div><div aria-labelledby="tab-2-UHl0aG9u" class="sphinx-tabs-panel code-tab group-tab" hidden="true" id="panel-2-UHl0aG9u" name="UHl0aG9u" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">requests</span>
<span class="n">URL</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/projects/&#39;</span>
<span class="n">TOKEN</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;&lt;token&gt;&#39;</span>
<span class="n">HEADERS</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;Authorization&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="sa">f</span><span class="s1">&#39;token </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">TOKEN</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="n">response</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">requests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">URL</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">headers</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">HEADERS</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">response</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">json</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div></div>
<p><strong>Example response</strong>:</p>
<div class="highlight-json notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;count&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">25</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;next&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;/api/v3/projects/?limit=10&amp;offset=10&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;previous&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;results&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[{</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;id&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="mi">12345</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;name&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Pip&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;slug&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;pip&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;created&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;2010-10-23T18:12:31+00:00&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;modified&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;2018-12-11T07:21:11+00:00&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;language&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;code&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;en&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;name&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;English&quot;</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;programming_language&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;code&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;py&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;name&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Python&quot;</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;repository&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;url&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;https://github.com/pypa/pip&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;type&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;git&quot;</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;default_version&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;stable&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;default_branch&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;master&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;subproject_of&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;translation_of&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;urls&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;documentation&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;http://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;home&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;https://pip.pypa.io/&quot;</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;tags&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="s2">&quot;distutils&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="s2">&quot;easy_install&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="s2">&quot;egg&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="s2">&quot;setuptools&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="s2">&quot;virtualenv&quot;</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;users&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">                </span><span class="nt">&quot;username&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;dstufft&quot;</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;active_versions&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;stable&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;{VERSION}&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;latest&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;{VERSION}&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;19.0.2&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;{VERSION}&quot;</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;_links&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;_self&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;/api/v3/projects/pip/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;versions&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;/api/v3/projects/pip/versions/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;builds&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;/api/v3/projects/pip/builds/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;subprojects&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;/api/v3/projects/pip/subprojects/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;superproject&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;/api/v3/projects/pip/superproject/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;redirects&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;/api/v3/projects/pip/redirects/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;translations&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;/api/v3/projects/pip/translations/&quot;</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">}]</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Query Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<em>string</em>) ‚Äì return projects with matching name</p></li>
<li><p><strong>slug</strong> (<em>string</em>) ‚Äì return projects with matching slug</p></li>
<li><p><strong>language</strong> (<em>string</em>) ‚Äì language code as <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">en</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">es</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ru</span></code>, etc.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>programming_language</strong> (<em>string</em>) ‚Äì programming language code as <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">py</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">js</span></code>, etc.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">results</span></code> in response is an array of project data,
which is same as <a class="reference internal" href="#get--api-v3-projects-(string-project_slug)-" title="GET /api/v3/projects/(string:project_slug)/"><code class="xref http http-get docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">GET</span> <span class="pre">/api/v3/projects/(string:project_slug)/</span></code></a>.</p>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<blockquote>
<div></div></blockquote>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-commercial/index"><span class="doc">Read the Docs for Business</span></a>, also accepts</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Query Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>expand</strong> (<em>string</em>) ‚Äì with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">organization</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">teams</span></code>.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</dd></dl>

</section>
<section id="project-details">
<h6>Project details<a class="headerlink" href="#project-details" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<dl class="http get">
<dt class="sig sig-object http" id="get--api-v3-projects-(string-project_slug)-">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">GET</span> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">/api/v3/projects/</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="property"><span class="pre">string:</span> </em><em class="sig-param"><span class="pre">project_slug</span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">/</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#get--api-v3-projects-(string-project_slug)-" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>Retrieve details of a single project.</p>
<p><strong>Example request</strong>:</p>
<div class="sphinx-tabs docutils container">
<div aria-label="Tabbed content" class="closeable" role="tablist"><button aria-controls="panel-3-QmFzaA==" aria-selected="true" class="sphinx-tabs-tab code-tab group-tab" id="tab-3-QmFzaA==" name="QmFzaA==" role="tab" tabindex="0">Bash</button><button aria-controls="panel-3-UHl0aG9u" aria-selected="false" class="sphinx-tabs-tab code-tab group-tab" id="tab-3-UHl0aG9u" name="UHl0aG9u" role="tab" tabindex="-1">Python</button></div><div aria-labelledby="tab-3-QmFzaA==" class="sphinx-tabs-panel code-tab group-tab" id="panel-3-QmFzaA==" name="QmFzaA==" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-bash notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>$<span class="w"> </span>curl<span class="w"> </span>-H<span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Authorization: Token &lt;token&gt;&quot;</span><span class="w"> </span>https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/projects/pip/
</pre></div>
</div>
</div><div aria-labelledby="tab-3-UHl0aG9u" class="sphinx-tabs-panel code-tab group-tab" hidden="true" id="panel-3-UHl0aG9u" name="UHl0aG9u" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">requests</span>
<span class="n">URL</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/projects/pip/&#39;</span>
<span class="n">TOKEN</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;&lt;token&gt;&#39;</span>
<span class="n">HEADERS</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;Authorization&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="sa">f</span><span class="s1">&#39;token </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">TOKEN</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="n">response</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">requests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">URL</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">headers</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">HEADERS</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">response</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">json</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div></div>

<div class="highlight-json notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span>

<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;modified&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;2018-12-11T07:21:11+00:00&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;language&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;code&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;en&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;name&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;English&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;programming_language&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;code&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;py&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;name&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Python&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;repository&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;url&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;https://github.com/pypa/pip&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;type&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;git&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;default_version&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;stable&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;default_branch&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;master&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;subproject_of&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;translation_of&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">null</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;urls&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;documentation&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;http://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;home&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;https://pip.pypa.io/&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;tags&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="s2">&quot;distutils&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="s2">&quot;easy_install&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="s2">&quot;egg&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="s2">&quot;setuptools&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="s2">&quot;virtualenv&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;users&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">            </span><span class="nt">&quot;username&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;dstufft&quot;</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;active_versions&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;stable&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;{VERSION}&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;latest&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;{VERSION}&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;19.0.2&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;{VERSION}&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">},</span>

<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;versions&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;/api/v3/projects/pip/versions/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>

<span class="p">}</span>

<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Query Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>expand</strong> (<em>string</em>) ‚Äì allows to add/expand some extra fields in the response.
Allowed values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">active_versions</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">active_versions.last_build</span></code> and
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">active_versions.last_build.config</span></code>. Multiple fields can be passed separated by commas.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<blockquote>
<div></div></blockquote>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-commercial/index"><span class="doc">Read the Docs for Business</span></a>, also accepts</p>

</dd></dl>

<section id="project-create">
<h6>Project create<a class="headerlink" href="#project-create" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<dl class="http post">
<dt class="sig sig-object http" id="post--api-v3-projects-">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">POST</span> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">/api/v3/projects/</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#post--api-v3-projects-" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>Import a project under authenticated user.</p>
<p><strong>Example request</strong>:</p>
<div class="sphinx-tabs docutils container">
<div aria-label="Tabbed content" class="closeable" role="tablist"><button aria-controls="panel-4-QmFzaA==" aria-selected="true" class="sphinx-tabs-tab code-tab group-tab" id="tab-4-QmFzaA==" name="QmFzaA==" role="tab" tabindex="0">Bash</button><button aria-controls="panel-4-UHl0aG9u" aria-selected="false" class="sphinx-tabs-tab code-tab group-tab" id="tab-4-UHl0aG9u" name="UHl0aG9u" role="tab" tabindex="-1">Python</button></div><div aria-labelledby="tab-4-QmFzaA==" class="sphinx-tabs-panel code-tab group-tab" id="panel-4-QmFzaA==" name="QmFzaA==" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-bash notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>$<span class="w"> </span>curl<span class="w"> </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="w">  </span>-X<span class="w"> </span>POST<span class="w"> </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="w">  </span>-H<span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Authorization: Token &lt;token&gt;&quot;</span><span class="w"> </span>https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/projects/<span class="w"> </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="w">  </span>-H<span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Content-Type: application/json&quot;</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="w">  </span>-d<span class="w"> </span>@body.json
</pre></div>
</div>
</div><div aria-labelledby="tab-4-UHl0aG9u" class="sphinx-tabs-panel code-tab group-tab" hidden="true" id="panel-4-UHl0aG9u" name="UHl0aG9u" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">requests</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">json</span>
<span class="n">URL</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/projects/&#39;</span>
<span class="n">TOKEN</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;&lt;token&gt;&#39;</span>
<span class="n">HEADERS</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;Authorization&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="sa">f</span><span class="s1">&#39;token </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">TOKEN</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">json</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">load</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;body.json&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;rb&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">response</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">requests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">post</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">URL</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">json</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">headers</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">HEADERS</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">response</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">json</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div></div>
<p>The content of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">body.json</span></code> is like,</p>
<div class="highlight-json notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;name&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Test Project&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;repository&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;url&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;https://github.com/readthedocs/template&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;type&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;git&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;homepage&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;http://template.readthedocs.io/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;programming_language&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;py&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;language&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;es&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;privacy_level&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;public&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;external_builds_privacy_level&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;public&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;tags&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="s2">&quot;automation&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="s2">&quot;sphinx&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p><strong>Example response</strong>:</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="#project-details">See Project details</a></p>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<blockquote>
<div></div></blockquote>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-commercial/index"><span class="doc">Read the Docs for Business</span></a>, also accepts</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Request JSON Object<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>organization</strong> (<em>string</em>) ‚Äì required organization‚Äôs slug under the project will be imported.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>teams</strong> (<em>string</em>) ‚Äì optional teams‚Äô slugs the project will belong to.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Privacy levels are only available in <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-commercial/index"><span class="doc">Read the Docs for Business</span></a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

</section>
<section id="project-update">
<h6>Project update<a class="headerlink" href="#project-update" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<dl class="http patch">
<dt class="sig sig-object http" id="patch--api-v3-projects-(string-project_slug)-">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">PATCH</span> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">/api/v3/projects/</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="property"><span class="pre">string:</span> </em><em class="sig-param"><span class="pre">project_slug</span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">/</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#patch--api-v3-projects-(string-project_slug)-" title="Permalink to this definition">ÔÉÅ</a></dt>
<dd><p>Update an existing project.</p>
<p><strong>Example request</strong>:</p>
<div class="sphinx-tabs docutils container">
<div aria-label="Tabbed content" class="closeable" role="tablist"><button aria-controls="panel-5-QmFzaA==" aria-selected="true" class="sphinx-tabs-tab code-tab group-tab" id="tab-5-QmFzaA==" name="QmFzaA==" role="tab" tabindex="0">Bash</button><button aria-controls="panel-5-UHl0aG9u" aria-selected="false" class="sphinx-tabs-tab code-tab group-tab" id="tab-5-UHl0aG9u" name="UHl0aG9u" role="tab" tabindex="-1">Python</button></div><div aria-labelledby="tab-5-QmFzaA==" class="sphinx-tabs-panel code-tab group-tab" id="panel-5-QmFzaA==" name="QmFzaA==" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-bash notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>$<span class="w"> </span>curl<span class="w"> </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="w">  </span>-X<span class="w"> </span>PATCH<span class="w"> </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="w">  </span>-H<span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Authorization: Token &lt;token&gt;&quot;</span><span class="w"> </span>https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/projects/pip/<span class="w"> </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="w">  </span>-H<span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;Content-Type: application/json&quot;</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="w">  </span>-d<span class="w"> </span>@body.json
</pre></div>
</div>
</div><div aria-labelledby="tab-5-UHl0aG9u" class="sphinx-tabs-panel code-tab group-tab" hidden="true" id="panel-5-UHl0aG9u" name="UHl0aG9u" role="tabpanel" tabindex="0"><div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">requests</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">json</span>
<span class="n">URL</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;https://readthedocs.org/api/v3/projects/pip/&#39;</span>
<span class="n">TOKEN</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;&lt;token&gt;&#39;</span>
<span class="n">HEADERS</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;Authorization&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="sa">f</span><span class="s1">&#39;token </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">TOKEN</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">json</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">load</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;body.json&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;rb&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">response</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">requests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">patch</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">URL</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">json</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">headers</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">HEADERS</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">response</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">json</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div></div>
<p>The content of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">body.json</span></code> is like,</p>
<div class="highlight-json notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;name&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;New name for the project&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;repository&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;url&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="nt">&quot;type&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;git&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">},</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;language&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;ja&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;programming_language&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;py&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;homepage&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;https://readthedocs.org/&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;tags&quot;</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="s2">&quot;extension&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">        </span><span class="s2">&quot;mkdocs&quot;</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;default_version&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;v0.27.0&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;default_branch&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;develop&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;analytics_code&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;UA000000&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;analytics_disabled&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;single_version&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;external_builds_enabled&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">true</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;privacy_level&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;public&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;external_builds_privacy_level&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;public&quot;</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Adding <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tags</span></code> will replace existing tags with the new list,
and if omitted won‚Äôt change the tags.</p>
</div>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>Privacy levels are only available in <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-commercial/index"><span class="doc">Read the Docs for Business</span></a>.</p>
</div>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Status Codes<span class="colon">:</span></dt>

<li><p><span><a class="reference external" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html#sec10.2.5">204 No Content</a></span> ‚Äì Updated successfully</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

</dd></dl>
