<section id="version-4-1-8">
<h3>Version 4.1.8<a class="headerlink" href="#version-4-1-8" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Date<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>May 05, 2020</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>This release adds a few new features and bugfixes.
The largest change is the addition of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">hidden</span></code> versions,
which allows docs to be built but not shown to users on the site.
This will keep old links from breaking but not direct new users there.</p>
<p>We‚Äôve also expanded the CDN support to make sure we‚Äôre passing headers on 3xx and 4xx responses.
This will allow us to expand the timeout on our CDN.</p>
<p>We‚Äôve also updated and added a good amount of documentation in this release,
and we‚Äôre starting a larger refactor of our docs to help users understand the platform better.</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Cleanup unresolver logging (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/7019">#7019</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Add CDN to the installed apps (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/7014">#7014</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/eric-wieser">&#64;eric-wieser</a>: Emit a better error if no feature flag is found (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/7009">#7009</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Add proxito headers to redirect responses (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/7007">#7007</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Add Priority 0 to Celery (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/7006">#7006</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Update conftest (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/7002">#7002</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Start storing JSON data for PR builds (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/7001">#7001</a>)</p></li>

<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Update common (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6997">#6997</a>)</p></li>

<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Mention concurrent builds limitation in ‚ÄúBuild Process‚Äù (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6993">#6993</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Show a list of packages installed on environment (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6992">#6992</a>)</p></li>

<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Add support for Mkdocs search (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6937">#6937</a>)</p></li>

<section id="version-4-1-7">
<h3>Version 4.1.7<a class="headerlink" href="#version-4-1-7" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Date<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>April 28, 2020</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>As of this release, most documentation on Read the Docs Community is now behind Cloudflare‚Äôs CDN.
It should be much faster for people further from US East.
Please report any issues you experience with stale cached documentation (especially CSS/JS).</p>
<p>Another change in this release related to how custom domains are handled.
Custom domains will now redirect HTTP -&gt; HTTPS if the Domain‚Äôs ‚ÄúHTTPS‚Äù flag is set.
Also, the subdomain URL (eg. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">&lt;project&gt;.readthedocs.io/...</span></code>) should redirect to the custom domain
if the Domain‚Äôs ‚Äúcanonical‚Äù flag is set.
These flags are configurable in your project dashboard under <span class="guilabel">Admin</span> &gt; <span class="guilabel">Domains</span>.</p>
<p>Many of the other changes related to improvements for our infrastructure
to allow us to have autoscaling build and web servers.
There were bug fixes for projects using versions tied to annotated git tags
and custom user redirects will now send query parameters.</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Reduce proxito logging (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6970">#6970</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Log build/sync tasks when triggered (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6967">#6967</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Stop builders gracefully on SIGTERM (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6960">#6960</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Try to fix annotated tags (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6959">#6959</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Include query params in 404 redirects (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6957">#6957</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Fix the trailing slash in our repo regexs (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6956">#6956</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/davidfischer">&#64;davidfischer</a>: Add canonical to the Domain listview in the admin (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6954">#6954</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/davidfischer">&#64;davidfischer</a>: Allow setting HSTS on a per domain basis (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6953">#6953</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Refactor how we handle GitHub webhook events (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6949">#6949</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Return 400 when importing an already existing project (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6948">#6948</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Return max_concurrent_builds in ProjectAdminSerializer (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6946">#6946</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/tom-doerr">&#64;tom-doerr</a>: Update year (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6945">#6945</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Revert ‚ÄúUse requests.head to query storage.exists‚Äù (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6941">#6941</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Release 4.1.6 (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6940">#6940</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Remove note about search analytics being beta (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6939">#6939</a>)</p></li>

<section id="version-4-0-0">
<h3>Version 4.0.0<a class="headerlink" href="#version-4-0-0" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Date<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>February 25, 2020</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p><strong>This release upgrades our codebase to run on Django 2.2</strong>.
This is a breaking change,
so we have released it as our 4th major version.</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Data migration for old integration models (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6675">#6675</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Release 3.12.0 (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6674">#6674</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Upgrade to Django 2.2.9 (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6494">#6494</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/davidfischer">&#64;davidfischer</a>: Show message if version list truncated (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6276">#6276</a>)</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="version-3-12-0">
<h3>Version 3.12.0<a class="headerlink" href="#version-3-12-0" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Date<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>February 18, 2020</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>This version has two major changes:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>It updates our default docker images to stable=5.0 and latest=6.0.</p></li>
<li><p>It changes our PR builder domain to <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">readthedocs.build</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Use PUBLIC_DOMAIN_USES_HTTPS for resolver tests (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6673">#6673</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Always run CoreTagsTests with http (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6671">#6671</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Remove old docker settings (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6670">#6670</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Update gitpython and django (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6667">#6667</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: New docker release (6.0 and testing) (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6654">#6654</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Default python version per Docker image (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6653">#6653</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Add pytest-custom_exit_code (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6648">#6648</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Initial attempt to serve PR builds at <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">readthedocs.build</span></code> (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6629">#6629</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Remove re-authing of users on downloads. (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6619">#6619</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/stsewd">&#64;stsewd</a>: Don‚Äôt trigger a sync twice on creation/deletion for GitHub (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6614">#6614</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/s-weigand">&#64;s-weigand</a>: Add linkcheck test for the docs (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/6543">#6543</a>)</p></li>
</ul>
</section>

<h3>Version 2.2.1<a class="headerlink" href="#version-2-2-1" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Version <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2.2.1</span></code> is a bug fix release for the several issues found in
production during the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2.2.0</span></code> release.</p>
<blockquote>
<div><ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/agjohnson">&#64;agjohnson</a>: Hotfix for adding logging call back into project sync task (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/3657">#3657</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/agjohnson">&#64;agjohnson</a>: Fix issue with missing setting in oauth SyncRepo task (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/3656">#3656</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Tests for build notifications (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/3654">#3654</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Send proper context to celery email notification task (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/3653">#3653</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/ericholscher">&#64;ericholscher</a>: Remove error logging that isn‚Äôt an error. (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/3650">#3650</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/davidfischer">&#64;davidfischer</a>: Update RTD security docs (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/3641">#3641</a>)</p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/humitos">&#64;humitos</a>: Ability to override the creation of the Celery App (<a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/pull/3623">#3623</a>)</p></li>
</ul>
</div></blockquote>
</section>

<section id="previous-releases">
<h3>Previous releases<a class="headerlink" href="#previous-releases" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Starting with version <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2.0</span></code>, we will be incrementing the Read the Docs version
based on semantic versioning principles, and will be automating the update of
our changelog.</p>
<p>Below are some historical changes from when we have tried to add information
here in the past</p>
<section id="july-23-2015">
<h4>July 23, 2015<a class="headerlink" href="#july-23-2015" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Django 1.8 Support Merged</p></li>
</ul>
<section id="code-notes">
<h5>Code notes<a class="headerlink" href="#code-notes" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Updated Django from <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.6.11</span></code> to <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.8.3</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p>Removed South and ported the South migrations to Django‚Äôs migration framework.</p></li>
<li><p>Updated django-celery from <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.0.23</span></code> to <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.1.26</span></code> as django-celery 3.0.x does not support Django 1.8.</p></li>
<li><p>Updated Celery from <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.0.24</span></code> to <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3.1.18</span></code> because we had to update django-celery. We need to test this extensively and might need to think about using the new Celery API directly and dropping django-celery.
See release notes: <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.celeryproject.org/en/3.1/whatsnew-3.1.html">https://docs.celeryproject.org/en/3.1/whatsnew-3.1.html</a></p></li>
<li><p>Updated tastypie from <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0.11.1</span></code> to current master (commit <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1e1aff3dd4dcd21669e9c68bd7681253b286b856</span></code>) as 0.11.x is not compatible with Django 1.8. No surprises expected but we should ask for a proper release, see release notes: <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/django-tastypie/django-tastypie/blob/master/docs/release_notes/v0.12.0.rst">https://github.com/django-tastypie/django-tastypie/blob/master/docs/release_notes/v0.12.0.rst</a></p></li>
<li><p>Updated django-oauth from <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0.16.1</span></code> to <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0.21.0</span></code>. No surprises expected, see release notes <a class="reference external" href="https://django-allauth.readthedocs.io/en/latest/release-notes.html">in the docs</a> and <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/pennersr/django-allauth/blob/9123223f167959e4e5c4074408db068f725559d1/ChangeLog#L1-169">finer grained in the repo</a></p></li>
<li><p>Updated django-guardian from <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.2.0</span></code> to <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.3.0</span></code> to gain Django 1.8 support. No surprises expected, see release notes: <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/lukaszb/django-guardian/blob/devel/CHANGES">https://github.com/lukaszb/django-guardian/blob/devel/CHANGES</a></p></li>
<li><p>Using <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">django-formtools</span></code> instead of removed <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">django.contrib.formtools</span></code> now. Based on the Django release notes, these modules are the same except of the package name.</p></li>
<li><p>Updated pytest-django from <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2.6.2</span></code> to <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2.8.0</span></code>. No tests required, but running the testsuite :smile:</p></li>
<li><p>Updated psycopg2 from 2.4 to 2.4.6 as 2.4.5 is required by Django 1.8. No trouble expected as Django is the layer between us and psycopg2. Also it‚Äôs only a minor version upgrade. Release notes: <a class="reference external" href="http://initd.org/psycopg/docs/news.html#what-s-new-in-psycopg-2-4-6">http://initd.org/psycopg/docs/news.html#what-s-new-in-psycopg-2-4-6</a></p></li>
<li><p>Added <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">django.setup()</span></code> to <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">conf.py</span></code> to load django properly for doc builds.</p></li>
<li><p>Added migrations for all apps with models in the <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">readthedocs/</span></code> directory</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="deployment-notes">
<h5>Deployment notes<a class="headerlink" href="#deployment-notes" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>After you have updated the code and installed the new dependencies, you need to run these commands on the server:</p>
<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">python</span> <span class="n">manage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">py</span> <span class="n">migrate</span> <span class="n">contenttypes</span>
<span class="n">python</span> <span class="n">manage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">py</span> <span class="n">migrate</span> <span class="n">projects</span> <span class="mi">0002</span> <span class="o">--</span><span class="n">fake</span>
<span class="n">python</span> <span class="n">manage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">py</span> <span class="n">migrate</span> <span class="o">--</span><span class="n">fake</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">initial</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Locally I had trouble in a test environment that pip did not update to the specified commit of tastypie. It might be required to use <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pip</span> <span class="pre">install</span> <span class="pre">-U</span> <span class="pre">-r</span> <span class="pre">requirements/deploy.txt</span></code> during deployment.</p>
</section>
<section id="development-update-notes">
<h5>Development update notes<a class="headerlink" href="#development-update-notes" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>The readthedocs developers need to execute these commands when switching to this branch (or when this got merged into <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">main</span></code>):</p>
<ul>
<li><p><strong>Before updating</strong> please make sure that all migrations are applied:</p>
<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">python</span> <span class="n">manage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">py</span> <span class="n">syncdb</span>
<span class="n">python</span> <span class="n">manage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">py</span> <span class="n">migrate</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</li>
<li><p>Update the codebase: <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">git</span> <span class="pre">pull</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>You need to update the requirements with <code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pip</span> <span class="pre">install</span> <span class="pre">-r</span> <span class="pre">requirements.txt</span></code></p></li>
<li><p>Now you need to fake the initial migrations:</p>
<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">python</span> <span class="n">manage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">py</span> <span class="n">migrate</span> <span class="n">contenttypes</span>
<span class="n">python</span> <span class="n">manage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">py</span> <span class="n">migrate</span> <span class="n">projects</span> <span class="mi">0002</span> <span class="o">--</span><span class="n">fake</span>
<span class="n">python</span> <span class="n">manage</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">py</span> <span class="n">migrate</span> <span class="o">--</span><span class="n">fake</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">initial</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</li>
</ul>
</section>
</section>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-about/index"></span><section id="about-read-the-docs">
<h2>About Read the Docs<a class="headerlink" href="#about-read-the-docs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h2>
<p>Read the Docs is a C Corporation registered in Oregon.
Our bootstrapped company is owned and fully controlled by the founders,
and fully funded by our customers and advertisers.
This allows us to <strong>focus 100% on our users</strong>.</p>
<p>We have two main sources of revenue:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Read the Docs for Business - where we <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.com">provide</a> a valuable paid service to companies.</p></li>
<li><p>Read the Docs Community - where we provide a free service to the open source community, funded via <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-advertising/ethical-advertising"><span class="doc">EthicalAds</span></a>.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>We believe that having both paying customers and ethical advertising is the best way to create a sustainable platform for our users.
We have built something that we expect to last a long time,
and we are able to make decisions based only on the best interest of our community and customers.</p>
<p>All of the source code for Read the Docs is open source.
You are welcome to <a class="reference external" href="https://dev.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contribute.html" title="(in Read the Docs developer documentation v9.13.0)"><span class="xref std std-doc">contribute</span></a> the features you want or run your own instance.
We should note that we generally only support our hosted versions as a matter of <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-open-source-philosophy"><span class="doc">our philosophy</span></a>.</p>
<p>We owe a great deal to the open source community that we are a part of,
so we provide free ads via our <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#community-ads"><span class="std std-ref">community ads</span></a> program.
This allows us to give back to the communities and projects that we support and depend on.</p>
<p>We are proud about the way we manage our company and products,
and are glad to have you on board with us in this <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-story"><span class="doc">great documentation journey</span></a>.</p>
<p>If you want to dive more into more specific information and our policies,
we‚Äôve brought most of the most important ones below.</p>

<p>We offer Read the Docs for Business for building and hosting commercial documentation.</p>

In order to get started quickly and easily, a <a class="reference external" href="https://about.readthedocs.com/pricing/">trial option</a> is provided free of charge.</p>

<p>In addition to providing the same features as Read the Docs Community,
commercial subscriptions to Read the Docs add additional features and run on separate infrastructure.</p>

<span id="document-reference/policies"></span><section id="policies-and-legal-documents">
<h3>Policies and legal documents<a class="headerlink" href="#policies-and-legal-documents" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h3>
<p>Here is some of the fine print used by Read the Docs Community and Read the Docs for Business:</p>
<div class="toctree-wrapper compound">
<span id="document-abandoned-projects"></span><section id="abandoned-projects-policy">
<h4>Abandoned projects policy<a class="headerlink" href="#abandoned-projects-policy" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>This policy describes the process by which a Read the Docs project <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-slug"><span class="xref std std-term">slug</span></a> may be changed.</p>
<div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>If you want to de-list a project‚Äôs fork from search results, please see <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-unofficial-projects"><span class="doc">Unofficial and unmaintained projects policy</span></a>.</p>
</div>
<section id="rationale">
<h5>Rationale<a class="headerlink" href="#rationale" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Conflict between the current use of the name and a different suggested use of
the same name occasionally arise.  This document aims to provide general
guidelines for solving the most typical cases of such conflicts.</p>
</section>
<section id="specification">
<h5>Specification<a class="headerlink" href="#specification" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>The main idea behind this policy is that Read the Docs serves the community.  Every
user is invited to upload content under the Terms of Use, understanding that it
is at the sole risk of the user.</p>
<p>While Read the Docs is not a backup service, the core team of Read the Docs does their best to keep that
content accessible indefinitely in its published form. However, in certain
edge cases the greater community‚Äôs needs might outweigh the individual‚Äôs
expectation of ownership of a project name.</p>
<p>The use cases covered by this policy are:</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt>Abandoned projects</dt><dd><p>Renaming a project so that the original project name can be used by a
different project</p>
</dd>
<dt>Active projects</dt><dd><p>Resolving disputes over a name</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</section>
<section id="implementation">
<h5>Implementation<a class="headerlink" href="#implementation" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<section id="reachability">
<h6>Reachability<a class="headerlink" href="#reachability" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>The user of Read the Docs is solely responsible for being reachable by the core team
for matters concerning projects that the user owns. In every case where
contacting the user is necessary, the core team will try to do so,
using the following means of contact:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>E-mail address on file in the user‚Äôs profile</p></li>
<li><p>E-mail addresses found in the given project‚Äôs documentation</p></li>
<li><p>E-mail address on the project‚Äôs home page</p></li>
</ul>
<p>The core team will stop trying to reach the user after six weeks and the user
will be considered <em>unreachable</em>.</p>
</section>
<section id="abandoned-projects">
<h6>Abandoned projects<a class="headerlink" href="#abandoned-projects" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>A project is considered <em>abandoned</em> when ALL of the following are met:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Owner is unreachable (see <a class="reference internal" href="#reachability">Reachability</a>)</p></li>
<li><p>The project has no proper documentation being served (no successful builds) or
does not have any releases within the past twelve months</p></li>
<li><p>No activity from the owner on the project‚Äôs home page (or no home page
found).</p></li>
</ul>
<p>All other projects are considered <em>active</em>.</p>
</section>
<section id="renaming-of-an-abandoned-project">
<h6>Renaming of an abandoned project<a class="headerlink" href="#renaming-of-an-abandoned-project" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Projects are never renamed solely on the basis of abandonment.</p>
<p>An <em>abandoned</em> project can be renamed (by appending <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">-abandoned</span></code> and a
uniquifying integer if needed) for purposes of reusing the name when ALL of the
following are met:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>The project has been determined <em>abandoned</em> by the rules described above</p></li>
<li><p>The candidate is able to demonstrate their own failed attempts to contact the
existing owner</p></li>
<li><p>The candidate is able to demonstrate that the project suggested to reuse the
name already exists and meets notability requirements</p></li>
<li><p>The candidate is able to demonstrate why a fork under a different name is not
an acceptable workaround</p></li>
<li><p>The project has fewer than 100 monthly pageviews</p></li>
<li><p>The core team does not have any additional reservations.</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="name-conflict-resolution-for-active-projects">
<h6>Name conflict resolution for active projects<a class="headerlink" href="#name-conflict-resolution-for-active-projects" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>The core team of Read the Docs are not arbiters in disputes around <em>active</em> projects.
The core team recommends users to get in touch with each other and solve the
issue by respectful communication.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="prior-art">
<h5>Prior art<a class="headerlink" href="#prior-art" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>The Python Package Index (PyPI) policy for claiming abandoned packages
(<a class="reference external" href="https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0541">PEP-0541</a>) heavily
influenced this policy.</p>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-unofficial-projects"></span><section id="unofficial-and-unmaintained-projects-policy">
<h4>Unofficial and unmaintained projects policy<a class="headerlink" href="#unofficial-and-unmaintained-projects-policy" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>This policy describes a process where we take actions against <a class="reference external" href="#unmaintained-projects">unmaintained</a> and <a class="reference external" href="#unofficial-projects">unofficial</a> forks of project documentation.</p>
<div class="admonition tip">
<p class="admonition-title">Tip</p>
<p>If you want to free up a project‚Äôs <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#term-slug"><span class="xref std std-term">slug</span></a> and gain access over it, please see <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-abandoned-projects"><span class="doc">Abandoned projects policy</span></a>.</p>
</div>
<section id="rationale">
<h5>Rationale<a class="headerlink" href="#rationale" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Documentation projects may be kept online indefinitely, even though a newer version of the same project exists elsewhere.
There are many reasons this can happen,
including forks, old official docs that are unmaintained, and many other situations.</p>
<p>The problem with old, outdated docs is that users will find them in search results,
and get confused to the validity of them.
Projects will then get support requests from people who are using an old and incorrect documentation version.</p>
<p>We have this policy to allow a reporter to request the <em>delisting</em> of forks that are old and outdated.</p>
<section id="high-level-overview">
<h6>High level overview<a class="headerlink" href="#high-level-overview" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>The process at a high level looks like:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>A reporter contacts us about a project they think is outdated and unofficial</p></li>
<li><p>A Read the Docs team member evaluates it to make sure it‚Äôs outdated and unofficial, according to this policy</p></li>
<li><p>We delist this project from search results and send an email to owners of the Read the Docs project</p></li>
<li><p>If a project owner objects, we evaluate their evidence and make a final decision</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
</section>
<section id="definitions">
<h5>Definitions<a class="headerlink" href="#definitions" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<section id="unofficial-projects">
<h6>Unofficial projects<a class="headerlink" href="#unofficial-projects" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>A project is considered <em>unofficial</em> when it is not linked to or mentioned in <strong>any</strong> of these places:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Websites and domains associated with the project</p></li>
<li><p>The project‚Äôs primary repository ‚Äì README files, repository description, or source code</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="unmaintained-projects">
<h6>Unmaintained projects<a class="headerlink" href="#unmaintained-projects" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>A project is considered <em>unmaintained</em> when <strong>any</strong> of the following are met:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>The configured version control repository is unreadable. This can happen if the repository is deleted, credentials are broken or the Git host is permanently unresponsive.</p></li>
<li><p>The project is only serving content from releases and commits 6 months or older.</p></li>
<li><p>All builds have failed for more than 6 months.</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
</section>
<section id="implementation">
<h5>Implementation<a class="headerlink" href="#implementation" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<section id="requesting-a-project-be-delisted">
<h6>Requesting a project be delisted<a class="headerlink" href="#requesting-a-project-be-delisted" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>You can request that we delist an outdated, unmaintained documentation by contacting our <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-support"><span class="doc">Site support</span></a>.</p>
<p>Please include the following information:</p>
<div class="highlight-text notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>URL of unofficial and unmaintained documentation project: ...
URL of official documentation (if any): ...
URL of official project website (if any): ...
URL of official project repository (if any): ...

Describe attempts of reaching the owner(s) of the documentation project:
...
</pre></div>
</div>
</section>
<section id="delisting">
<h6>Delisting<a class="headerlink" href="#delisting" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Projects that are determined to be <a class="reference external" href="#unmaintained-projects">unmaintained</a> and <a class="reference external" href="#unofficial-projects">unofficial</a> will have a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">robots.txt</span></code> file added that removes them from all search results:</p>
<div class="highlight-text notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span># robots.txt
User-agent: *
# This project is delisted according to the Unofficial and Unmaintanied Project Policy
# https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/unofficial-projects.html
Disallow: /
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Projects will be delisted if they meet <strong>all</strong> of the following criteria:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>The person who submits the report of the <a class="reference external" href="#unmaintained-projects">unmaintained</a> and <a class="reference external" href="#unofficial-projects">unofficial</a> project also demonstrates failed attempts to contact the existing owners.</p></li>
<li><p>The project has been determined <a class="reference external" href="#unmaintained-projects">unmaintained</a> and <a class="reference external" href="#unofficial-projects">unofficial</a> by the rules described above.</p></li>
<li><p>The core team does not have any additional reservations.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>The Read the Docs team will do the following actions when a project is delisted:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Notify the Read the Docs project owners via email about the delisting.</p></li>
<li><p>Add the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">robots.txt</span></code> file to be served on the project domain.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>If any of the project owners respond, their response will be taken into account, and the delisting might be reversed.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="thinking-behind-the-policy">
<h5>Thinking behind the policy<a class="headerlink" href="#thinking-behind-the-policy" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>The main idea behind this policy is that Read the Docs serves the community.
Every user is invited to upload content under <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-terms-of-service"><span class="doc">Read the Docs Terms of Service</span></a>,
understanding that it is at the sole risk of the user.</p>
<p>While Read the Docs is not a backup service, the core team of Read the Docs does their best to keep content accessible indefinitely in its published form. However, in certain edge cases,
the greater community‚Äôs needs might outweigh the individual‚Äôs expectation of continued publishing.</p>
</section>
<section id="prior-art">
<h5>Prior art<a class="headerlink" href="#prior-art" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>This policy is inspired by our <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-abandoned-projects"><span class="doc">Abandoned projects policy</span></a>.
The Python Package Index (PyPI) policy for claiming abandoned packages
(<a class="reference external" href="https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0541">PEP-0541</a>) heavily influenced this policy.</p>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-privacy-policy"></span><section id="privacy-policy">
<h4>Privacy Policy<a class="headerlink" href="#privacy-policy" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Effective date: <strong>February 21, 2023</strong></p>
<p>Welcome to Read the Docs.
At Read the Docs, we believe in protecting the privacy of our
users, authors, and readers.</p>
<section id="the-short-version">
<h5>The short version<a class="headerlink" href="#the-short-version" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>We collect your information only with your consent;
we only collect the minimum amount of personal information that is necessary
to fulfill the purpose of your interaction with us;
we don‚Äôt sell it to third parties;
and we only use it as this Privacy Policy describes.</p>
<p>Of course, the short version doesn‚Äôt tell you everything,
so please read on for more details!</p>
</section>
<section id="our-services">
<h5>Our services<a class="headerlink" href="#our-services" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Read the Docs is made up of:</p>
<dl class="simple">
<dt>readthedocs.org (‚ÄúRead the Docs Community‚Äù)</dt><dd><p>This is a website aimed at documentation authors and project maintainers
writing and distributing technical documentation.
This Privacy Policy applies to this site in full without reservation.</p>
</dd>
<dt>readthedocs.com (‚ÄúRead the Docs for Business‚Äù)</dt><dd><p>This website is a commercial hosted offering for hosting private
documentation for corporate clients.
This Privacy Policy applies to this site in full without reservation.</p>
</dd>
<dt>readthedocs.io, readthedocs-hosted.com, and other domains (‚ÄúDocumentation Sites‚Äù)</dt><dd><p>These websites are where Read the Docs hosts documentation (‚Äù<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#user-generated-content"><span class="std std-ref">User-Generated Content</span></a>‚Äù)
on behalf of documentation authors.
A best effort is made to apply
this Privacy Policy to these sites but the documentation
may contain content and files created by documentation authors.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>All use of Read the Docs is subject to this Privacy Policy, together with our <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-terms-of-service"><span class="doc">Terms of service</span></a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="what-information-read-the-docs-collects-and-why">
<h5>What information Read the Docs collects and why<a class="headerlink" href="#what-information-read-the-docs-collects-and-why" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<section id="information-from-website-browsers">
<h6>Information from website browsers<a class="headerlink" href="#information-from-website-browsers" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>If you‚Äôre <strong>just browsing the website</strong>, we collect the same basic information that most websites collect.
We use common internet technologies, such as cookies and web server logs.
We collect this basic information from everybody, whether they have an account or not.</p>
<p>The information we collect about all visitors to our website includes:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>the visitor‚Äôs browser type</p></li>
<li><p>language preference</p></li>
<li><p>referring site</p></li>
<li><p>the date and time of each visitor request</p></li>
</ul>
<p>We also collect potentially personally-identifying information
like Internet Protocol (IP) addresses.</p>
<section id="why-do-we-collect-this">
<h6 aria-level="7">Why do we collect this?<a class="headerlink" href="#why-do-we-collect-this" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>We collect this information to better understand how our website visitors
use Read the Docs, and to monitor and protect the security of the website.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="information-from-users-with-accounts">
<h6>Information from users with accounts<a class="headerlink" href="#information-from-users-with-accounts" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>If you <strong>create an account</strong>, we require some basic information at the time of account creation.
You will create your own user name and password, and we will ask you for a valid email account.
You also have the option to give us more information if you want to,
and this may include ‚ÄúUser Personal Information.‚Äù</p>
<p>‚ÄúUser Personal Information‚Äù is any information about one of our users which could,
alone or together with other information, personally identify him or her.
Information such as a user name and password, an email address,
a real name, and a photograph are examples of ‚ÄúUser Personal Information.‚Äù</p>
<p>User Personal Information does not include aggregated, non-personally identifying information.
We may use aggregated, non-personally identifying information to operate, improve,
and optimize our website and service.</p>
<section id="why-do-we-collect-this-information">
<h6 aria-level="7">Why do we collect this information?<a class="headerlink" href="#why-do-we-collect-this-information" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>We need your User Personal Information to create your account, and to provide the services you request.</p></li>
<li><p>We use your User Personal Information, specifically your user name, to identify you on Read the Docs.</p></li>
<li><p>We use it to fill out your profile and share that profile with other users.</p></li>
<li><p>We will use your email address to communicate with you but it is not shared publicly.</p></li>
<li><p>We limit our use of your User Personal Information to the purposes listed in this Privacy Statement.
If we need to use your User Personal Information for other purposes, we will ask your permission first.
You can always see what information we have in your
<a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/accounts/edit/">user account</a>.</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
</section>
</section>
<section id="what-information-read-the-docs-does-not-collect">
<h5>What information Read the Docs does not collect<a class="headerlink" href="#what-information-read-the-docs-does-not-collect" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>We do not intentionally collect <strong>sensitive personal information</strong>,
such as social security numbers, genetic data, health information, or religious information.</p>
<p>Documentation Sites hosted on Read the Docs are public,
anyone (including us) may view their contents.
If you have included private or sensitive information in your Documentation Site,
such as email addresses, that information may be indexed by search engines or used by third parties.</p>
<p>Read the Docs for Business may host <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#private-projects"><span class="std std-ref">private projects</span></a> which we treat as confidential
and we only access them for support reasons, with your consent, or if required to for security reasons</p>
<p>If you‚Äôre a <strong>child under the age of 13</strong>, you may not have an account on Read the Docs.
Read the Docs does not knowingly collect information from or direct any of our content specifically to children under 13.
If we learn or have reason to suspect that you are a user who is under the age of 13, we will unfortunately have to close your account.
We don‚Äôt want to discourage you from writing software documentation, but those are the rules.</p>
</section>
<section id="how-we-share-the-information-we-collect">
<h5>How we share the information we collect<a class="headerlink" href="#how-we-share-the-information-we-collect" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>We <strong>do not</strong> share, sell, rent, or trade User Personal Information with
third parties for their commercial purposes.</p>
<p>We do not disclose User Personal Information outside Read the Docs,
except in the situations listed in this section or
in the section below on compelled disclosure.</p>
<p>We <strong>do</strong> share certain aggregated, non-personally identifying information
with others about how our users, collectively, use Read the Docs.
For example, we may compile statistics on the prevalence of
different types of documentation across Read the Docs for a blog post
or popularity of programming languages for advertising partners.</p>
<p>We <strong>do</strong> host advertising on Documentation Sites.
This advertising is first-party advertising hosted by Read the Docs.
We <strong>do not</strong> run any code from advertisers and all ad images are hosted
on Read the Docs‚Äô servers. For more details, see our document on
<a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-advertising/advertising-details"><span class="doc">Advertising details</span></a>.</p>
<p>We may use User Personal Information with your permission,
so we can perform services you have requested.
For example, if you request service on commercially hosted docs,
we will ask your permission to sync your private repositories.</p>
<p>We may share User Personal Information with a limited number of third party vendors
who process it on our behalf to provide or improve our service,
and who have agreed to privacy restrictions similar to our own Privacy Statement.
For more details, see our next section on
<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#third-party-vendors"><span class="std std-ref">third parties</span></a>.</p>
<section id="third-party-vendors">
<h6>Third party vendors<a class="headerlink" href="#third-party-vendors" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>As we mentioned, we may share some information with third party vendors
or it may be collected by them on our behalf.
The information collected and stored by third parties
is subject to their policies and practices.
This list will be updated from time to time
and we encourage you to check back periodically.</p>
<section id="payment-processing">
<h6 aria-level="7">Payment processing<a class="headerlink" href="#payment-processing" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Should you choose to become a <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/sustainability/">Supporter</a>, purchase a <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/accounts/gold/">Gold membership</a>,
or become a subscriber to Read the Docs‚Äô commercial hosting product,
your payment information and details will be processed by Stripe.
Read the Docs does not store your payment information.</p>
</section>
<section id="site-monitoring">
<h6 aria-level="7">Site monitoring<a class="headerlink" href="#site-monitoring" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Read the Docs uses Sentry and New Relic to diagnose errors
and improve the performance of our site.
Both companies take part in the EU-US Privacy Shield framework.
We aim to minimize the amount of personal information shared,
but the information may include your IP address.</p>
</section>
<section id="analytics">
<h6 aria-level="7">Analytics<a class="headerlink" href="#analytics" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>We go into detail on analytics in a
<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#google-analytics"><span class="std std-ref">separate section specific to analytics</span></a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="support-desk">
<h6 aria-level="7">Support desk<a class="headerlink" href="#support-desk" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Read the Docs uses Front to manage support requests.
If you request support ‚Äì typically via email ‚Äì Front may process
your contact information.</p>
</section>
<section id="email-newsletter">
<h6 aria-level="7">Email newsletter<a class="headerlink" href="#email-newsletter" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>If you sign up for the Read the Docs email newsletter,
your email address and name will be stored by MailerLite.
This newsletter is separate from creating a Read the Docs account and
signing up for Read the Docs does not opt you in for the newsletter.</p>
<p>You can manage your email subscription
including unsubscribing and deleting your records with MailerLite.
There is a link to do so in the footer of any newsletter you receive from us.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="public-information-on-read-the-docs">
<h6>Public information on Read the Docs<a class="headerlink" href="#public-information-on-read-the-docs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Most of Read the Docs is public-facing including
user names, project names, and Documentation Sites.
If your content is public-facing, third parties may access it.
We do not sell that content; it is yours.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="our-use-of-cookies-and-tracking">
<h5>Our use of cookies and tracking<a class="headerlink" href="#our-use-of-cookies-and-tracking" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<section id="do-not-track">
<h6>Do Not Track<a class="headerlink" href="#do-not-track" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Read the Docs supports Do Not Track (DNT) and respects users‚Äô tracking preferences.
Specifically, we support the <a class="reference external" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/tracking-dnt/">W3C‚Äôs tracking preference expression</a>
and the <a class="reference external" href="https://www.eff.org/issues/do-not-track">EFF‚Äôs DNT Policy</a>.</p>
<p>For Read the Docs, this means:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>We <strong>do not</strong> do behavioral ad targeting regardless of your DNT preference.</p></li>
<li><p>When DNT is enabled, both logged-in and logged-out users
are considered opted-out of <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#google-analytics"><span class="std std-ref">analytics</span></a>.</p></li>
<li><p>Regardless of DNT preference, our logs that contain IP addresses
and user agent strings are deleted after 10 days unless a DNT exception applies.</p></li>
<li><p>Our full DNT policy is <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/.well-known/dnt-policy.txt">available here</a>.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>Our DNT policy applies without reservation
to Read the Docs Community and Read the Docs for Business.
A best effort is made to apply this to Documentation Sites,
but we do not have complete control over the contents of these sites.</p>
<p>For more details about DNT, visit <a class="reference external" href="https://www.allaboutdnt.com">All About Do Not Track</a>.</p>
<div class="admonition important">
<p class="admonition-title">Important</p>
<p>Due to the nature of our environment where documentation is built as necessary,
the DNT analytics opt-out for Documentation Sites only applies
for those sites generated after May 1, 2018.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section id="cookies">
<h6>Cookies<a class="headerlink" href="#cookies" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Read the Docs uses cookies to make interactions with our service easy and meaningful.
We use cookies to keep you logged in, remember your preferences,
and provide information for future development of Read the Docs.</p>
<p>A cookie is a small piece of text that our web server stores on your computer or mobile device,
which your browser sends to us when you return to our site.
Cookies do not necessarily identify you if you are merely visiting Read the Docs;
however, a cookie may store a unique identifier for each logged in user.
The cookies Read the Docs sets are essential for the operation of the website,
or are used for performance or functionality.
By using our website, you agree that we can place these types of cookies on your computer or device.
If you disable your browser or device‚Äôs ability to accept cookies,
you will not be able to log in to Read the Docs.</p>
</section>
<section id="google-analytics">
<h6>Google Analytics<a class="headerlink" href="#google-analytics" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>We use Google Analytics as a third party tracking service,
but we don‚Äôt use it to track you individually or collect your User Personal Information.
We use Google Analytics to collect information about how our website performs
and how our users, in general, navigate through and use Read the Docs.
This helps us evaluate our users‚Äô use of Read the Docs;
compile statistical reports on activity; and improve our content and website performance.</p>
<p>Google Analytics gathers certain simple, non-personally identifying information over time,
such as your IP address, browser type, internet service provider, referring and exit pages,
time stamp, and similar data about your use of Read the Docs.
We do not link this information to any of your personal information such as your user name.</p>
<p>Read the Docs will not, nor will we allow any third party to,
use the Google Analytics tool to track our users individually;
collect any User Personal Information other than IP address;
or correlate your IP address with your identity.
Google provides further information about its own privacy practices and offers a
<a class="reference external" href="https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout">browser add-on to opt out of Google Analytics tracking</a>.
You may also opt-out of analytics on Read the Docs by enabling
<a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#do-not-track"><span class="std std-ref">Do Not Track</span></a>.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="how-read-the-docs-secures-your-information">
<h5>How Read the Docs secures your information<a class="headerlink" href="#how-read-the-docs-secures-your-information" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Read the Docs takes all measures reasonably necessary to protect
User Personal Information from unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction;
maintain data accuracy; and help ensure the appropriate use of User Personal Information.
We follow generally accepted industry standards to protect the personal information
submitted to us, both during transmission and once we receive it.</p>
<p>No method of transmission, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure.
Therefore, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.</p>
</section>
<section id="read-the-docs-global-privacy-practices">
<h5>Read the Docs‚Äô global privacy practices<a class="headerlink" href="#read-the-docs-global-privacy-practices" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p><strong>Information that we collect will be stored and processed in the United States</strong>
in accordance with this Privacy Policy.
However, we understand that we have users from
different countries and regions with different privacy expectations,
and we try to meet those needs.</p>
<p>We provide the same standard of privacy protection to all our users around the world,
regardless of their country of origin or location,
Additionally, we require that if our vendors or affiliates have access to
User Personal Information, they must comply with our privacy policies and
with applicable data privacy laws.</p>
<p>In particular:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Read the Docs provides clear methods of unambiguous,
informed consent at the time of data collection,
when we do collect your personal data.</p></li>
<li><p>We collect only the minimum amount of personal data necessary, unless you choose to provide more.
We encourage you to only give us the amount of data you are comfortable sharing.</p></li>
<li><p>We offer you simple methods of accessing, correcting, or deleting the data we have collected.</p></li>
<li><p>We also provide our users a method of recourse and enforcement.</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="resolving-complaints">
<h5>Resolving complaints<a class="headerlink" href="#resolving-complaints" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>If you have concerns about the way Read the Docs is handling your User Personal Information,
please let us know immediately by emailing us at <a class="reference external" href="mailto:privacy&#37;&#52;&#48;readthedocs&#46;org">privacy<span>&#64;</span>readthedocs<span>&#46;</span>org</a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="how-we-respond-to-compelled-disclosure">
<h5>How we respond to compelled disclosure<a class="headerlink" href="#how-we-respond-to-compelled-disclosure" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Read the Docs may disclose personally-identifying information
or other information we collect about you to law enforcement in response
to a valid subpoena, court order, warrant, or similar government order,
or when we believe in good faith that disclosure is reasonably necessary
to protect our property or rights, or those of third parties or the public at large.</p>
<p>In complying with court orders and similar legal processes,
Read the Docs strives for transparency.
When permitted, we will make a reasonable effort to notify users
of any disclosure of their information,
unless we are prohibited by law or court order from doing so,
or in rare, exigent circumstances.</p>
</section>
<section id="how-you-can-access-and-control-the-information-we-collect">
<h5>How you can access and control the information we collect<a class="headerlink" href="#how-you-can-access-and-control-the-information-we-collect" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>If you‚Äôre already a Read the Docs user, you may access, update, alter,
or delete your basic user profile information by
<a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/accounts/edit/">editing your user account</a>.</p>
<section id="data-retention-and-deletion">
<h6>Data retention and deletion<a class="headerlink" href="#data-retention-and-deletion" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p>Read the Docs will retain User Personal Information for as long
as your account is active or as needed to provide you services.</p>
<p>We may retain certain User Personal Information indefinitely,
unless you delete it or request its deletion.
For example, we don‚Äôt automatically delete inactive user accounts,
so unless you choose to delete your account,
we will retain your account information indefinitely.</p>
<p>If you would like to delete your User Personal Information,
you may do so in your <a class="reference external" href="https://readthedocs.org/accounts/delete/">user account</a>.
We will retain and use your information as necessary to comply with
our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements,
but barring legal requirements, we will delete your full profile.</p>
<p>Our web server logs for Read the Docs Community,
Read the Docs for Business, and Documentation Sites
are deleted after 10 days barring legal obligations.</p>
</section>
</section>
<section id="changes-to-our-privacy-policy">
<h5>Changes to our Privacy Policy<a class="headerlink" href="#changes-to-our-privacy-policy" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>We reserve the right to revise this Privacy Policy at any time.
If we change this Privacy Policy in the future,
we will post the revised Privacy Policy and update the ‚ÄúEffective Date,‚Äù above,
to reflect the date of the changes.</p>
</section>
<section id="contacting-read-the-docs">
<h5>Contacting Read the Docs<a class="headerlink" href="#contacting-read-the-docs" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Questions regarding Read the Docs‚Äô Privacy Policy or
information practices should be directed to
<a class="reference external" href="mailto:privacy&#37;&#52;&#48;readthedocs&#46;org">privacy<span>&#64;</span>readthedocs<span>&#46;</span>org</a>.</p>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-legal/security-policy"></span><section id="security-policy">
<h4>Security policy<a class="headerlink" href="#security-policy" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Read the Docs adheres to the following security policies and procedures with
regards to development, operations, and managing infrastructure. You can also
find information on how we handle specific user data in our
<a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-privacy-policy"><span class="doc">Privacy Policy</span></a>.</p>
<p>Our engineering team monitors several sources for security threats and responds
accordingly to security threats and notifications.</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>We monitor 3rd party software included in our application and in our
infrastructure for security notifications. Any relevant security patches are
applied and released immediately.</p></li>
<li><p>We monitor our infrastructure providers for signs of attacks or abuse and will
respond accordingly to threats.</p></li>
</ul>
<section id="infrastructure">
<h5>Infrastructure<a class="headerlink" href="#infrastructure" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Read the Docs infrastructure is hosted on Amazon Web Services (AWS).  We also
use Cloudflare services to mitigate attacks and abuse.</p>
<div class="admonition seealso">
<p class="admonition-title">See also</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://aws.amazon.com/security/">AWS security policies</a></p></li>
<li><p><a class="reference external" href="https://www.cloudflare.com/privacypolicy/">Cloudflare privacy and security policies</a></p></li>
</ul>
</div>
</section>
<section id="data-and-data-center">
<h5>Data and data center<a class="headerlink" href="#data-and-data-center" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>All user data is stored in the USA in multi-tenant datastores in Amazon Web
Services data centers. Physical access to these data centers is secured with a
<a class="reference external" href="https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/data-center/controls/">variety of controls</a> to prevent unauthorized access.</p>
</section>
<section id="application">
<h5>Application<a class="headerlink" href="#application" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<dl class="simple">
<dt>Encryption in transit</dt><dd><p>All documentation, application dashboard, and API access is transmitted
using SSL encryption. We do not support unencrypted requests, even for
public project documentation hosting.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Temporary repository storage</dt><dd><p>We do not store or cache user repository data, temporary storage is used for
every project build on Read the Docs.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Authentication</dt><dd><p>Read the Docs supports SSO with GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and Google Workspaces
(formerly G Suite).</p>
</dd>
<dt>Payment security</dt><dd><p>We do not store or process any payment details. All payment information is
stored with our payment provider, Stripe ‚Äì a PCI-certified level 1 payment
provider.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</section>
<section id="engineering-and-operational-practices">
<h5>Engineering and operational practices<a class="headerlink" href="#engineering-and-operational-practices" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<dl class="simple">
<dt>Immutable infrastructure</dt><dd><p>We don‚Äôt make live changes to production code or infrastructure. All changes
to our application and our infrastructure go through the same code review
process before being applied and released.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Continuous integration</dt><dd><p>We are constantly testing changes to our application code and operational
changes to our infrastructure.</p>
</dd>
<dt>Incident response</dt><dd><p>Our engineering team is on a rotating on-call schedule to respond to
security or availability incidents.</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</section>
<section id="account-security">
<h5>Account security<a class="headerlink" href="#account-security" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>All traffic is encrypted in transit so your login is protected.</p></li>
<li><p>Read the Docs stores only one-way hashes of all passwords.
Nobody at Read the Docs has access to your passwords.</p></li>
<li><p>Account login is protected from brute force attacks with rate limiting.</p></li>
<li><p>While most projects and docs on Read the Docs are public,
we treat your private repositories and private documentation as confidential
and Read the Docs employees may only view them
with your explicit permission in response to your support requests,
or when required for security purposes.</p></li>
<li><p>You can read more about account privacy in our <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-privacy-policy"><span class="doc">Privacy Policy</span></a>.</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-security"></span><section id="security-reports">
<h4>Security reports<a class="headerlink" href="#security-reports" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
<p>Security is very important to us at Read the Docs.
We follow generally accepted industry standards to protect the personal information
submitted to us, both during transmission and once we receive it.
In the spirit of transparency,
we are committed to responsible reporting and disclosure of security issues.</p>

<section id="supported-versions">
<h5>Supported versions<a class="headerlink" href="#supported-versions" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>Only the latest version of Read the Docs will receive security updates.
We don‚Äôt support security updates for <a class="reference internal" href="index.html#document-open-source-philosophy"><span class="doc">custom installations</span></a> of Read the Docs.</p>
</section>
<section id="reporting-a-security-issue">
<h5>Reporting a security issue<a class="headerlink" href="#reporting-a-security-issue" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>If you believe you‚Äôve discovered a security issue at Read the Docs,
please contact us at <strong>security&#64;readthedocs.org</strong> (optionally using our <a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="#pgp-key"><span class="std std-ref">PGP key</span></a>).
We request that you please not publicly disclose the issue until it has been addressed by us.</p>
<p>You can expect:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>We will respond acknowledging your email typically within one business day.</p></li>
<li><p>We will follow up if and when we have confirmed the issue with a timetable for the fix.</p></li>
<li><p>We will notify you when the issue is fixed.</p></li>
<li><p>We will create a <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/security/advisories">GitHub advisory</a> and publish it when the issue has been fixed
and deployed in our platforms.</p></li>
</ul>
</section>
<section id="pgp-key">
<h5>PGP key<a class="headerlink" href="#pgp-key" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>You may use this <a class="reference download internal" download="" href="_downloads/37e127f3b4c52c9a970f3607dce9f440/pgpkey.txt"><code class="xref download docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">PGP</span> <span class="pre">key</span></code></a>
to securely communicate with us and to verify signed messages you receive from us.</p>
</section>
<section id="bug-bounties">
<h5>Bug bounties<a class="headerlink" href="#bug-bounties" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>While we sincerely appreciate and encourage reports of suspected security problems,
please note that the Read the Docs is an open source project, and <strong>does not run any bug bounty programs</strong>.</p>
</section>
<section id="security-issue-archive">
<h5>Security issue archive<a class="headerlink" href="#security-issue-archive" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h5>
<p>You can see all past reports at <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/security/advisories">https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/security/advisories</a>.</p>
<section id="version-3-2-0">
<h6>Version 3.2.0<a class="headerlink" href="#version-3-2-0" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#version-3-2-0"><span class="std std-ref">Version 3.2.0</span></a> resolved an issue where a specially crafted request
could result in a DNS query to an arbitrary domain.</p>
<p>This issue was found by <a class="reference external" href="https://www.cybersmartdefence.com/">Cyber Smart Defence</a>
who reported it as part of a security audit to a firm running a local installation
of Read the Docs.</p>
</section>
<section id="release-2-3-0">
<h6>Release 2.3.0<a class="headerlink" href="#release-2-3-0" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h6>
<p><a class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal" href="index.html#version-2-3-0"><span class="std std-ref">Version 2.3.0</span></a> resolves a security issue with translations on our community
hosting site that allowed users to modify the hosted path of a target project by
adding it as a translation project of their own project. A check was added to
ensure project ownership before adding the project as a translation.</p>
<p>In order to add a project as a translation now, users must now first be granted
ownership in the translation project.</p>
</section>
</section>
</section>
<span id="document-terms-of-service"></span><section id="read-the-docs-terms-of-service">
<h4>Read the Docs Terms of Service<a class="headerlink" href="#read-the-docs-terms-of-service" title="Permalink to this heading">ÔÉÅ</a></h4>
